module.name: Graphics
module.short: Contains classes and types used in graphic applications.

descr.p: graphics.pp contains classes, types, and routines used to represent graphic images in a Lazarus Component Library (LCL) application. The following classes are added to the registered class list used by the Run-time Library (RTL):
This file is part of the Lazarus Component Library (LCL).

element.name: PColor
element.short: Pointer to the TColor type.

element.name: TColor
element.short: Color type used by most LCL drawing functions.

descr.p: TColor is an alias for the TGraphicsColor type in GraphType.pp from the LazUtils package. TColor allows hexadecimal values in the range -$7FFFFFFF-1..$7FFFFFFF and represent the minimum and maximum values for the Long data type.
Bytes in the hexadecimal value are used as follows:

dl.dd: Opacity values are not used for standard LCL colors. $1F is reserved for clNone. $20 is reserved for clDefault.
Blue color level. $00 is none. $FF is full.
Green color level. $00 is none. $FF is full.
Red color level. $00 is none. $FF is full.

descr.p: There are predefined color constants like those in Delphi, such as: clBlack, clRed, clGreen, and clBlue. There are extended color constants, like: clMoneyGreen and clMedGray. There are special color constants like: clDefault and clNone.

Additionally, there are system color constants like: clWindowText and clForm. These constants have a color and/or pattern depending on the users theme, the LCL control, or the drawing tool (Pen, Brush, Font).
See ColorToRGB and RGBToColor.

element.name: TFontPitch
element.short: Represents pitches (or spacings) used in typefaces.

descr.p: Used to implement the Pitch member in TFontData and TFont.

element.name: TFontPitch.fpDefault
element.short: Font uses the default spacing defined for the typeface.

element.name: TFontPitch.fpVariable
element.short: Font uses variable pitch (or proportional spacing).

element.name: TFontPitch.fpFixed
element.short: Font uses fixed pitch (or mono-spacing).

descr.p: TFontName is an alias for the String type. Not used in the current LCL implementation.

element.name: TFontDataName
element.short: Short String type used for typeface names.

descr.p: TFontDataName is a Short String type used to represent typeface names, and is used to implement the Name member in TFontData. TFontData is defined with a maximum length of LF_FACESIZE-1.
descr.remark: Be aware that the definition can result in truncation of typeface names longer than 31 characters.

element.name: TFontStyle
element.short: Represents font styles or variants.
element.descr: TFontStyle is an enumerated type with values used to represent a style or variant for a typeface. Value(s) from TFontStyle are stored in the TFontStyles and TFontStylesBase set types, and used to implement the Style members in TFontData and TFont.

element.name: TFontStyle.fsBold
element.short: Bold font style.

element.name: TFontStyle.fsItalic
element.short: Italic font style.

element.name: TFontStyle.fsStrikeOut
element.short: Strike-out (or strike-through) font style.

element.name: TFontStyle.fsUnderline
element.short: Underline font style.

element.name: TFontStyles
element.short: Set type used to store TFontStyle value(s).

descr.p: TFontStyles is a set type used to store 0 ( zero) or more values from the TFontStyle enumeration.

element.name: TFontStylesBase
element.short: Set type used to store TFontStyle value(s).

descr.p: TFontStylesBase is a set type used to store 0 ( zero) or more values from the TFontStyle enumeration. It is used to implement the Style member in TFontData and TFont.

element.name: TFontCharSet
element.short: Represents a font character set as a numeric value.

descr.p: TFontCharSet is a range type with values representing font character sets. TFontCharSet is limited to integer values in the range 0..255, and correspond to the character set identifiers as used in the Win32 GDI LogFont structure. For other platforms, or widgetsets, the values used refer to constants defined in the widgetset interface.
TFontCharSet is the type used to implement the CharSet member in TFontData and TFont.

element.name: TFontQuality
element.short: Font output quality, like anti-aliasing.

descr.p: TFontQuality is an enumerated type with values that represent the output quality for fonts. Values in the enumeration control how carefully font attributes are applied to output using a font.
descr.remark: There are situations where an enumeration value may not produce the desired result. ClearType and ClearType Natural anti-aliasing algorithms are oriented to display usage. They cannot be applied to printed output in general. They are ignored for fonts that are not TrueType or OpenType fonts with TrueType outlines. Postscript Type 1 fonts, and Postscript OpenType fonts without TrueType outlines, do not use ClearType anti-aliasing. Bitmap, vector, and device fonts cannot use ClearType anti-aliasing. Fonts which contain embedded bitmaps, like most East Asian fonts, do not use ClearType anti-aliasing.
descr.p: TFontQuality is the type used to implement the Quality member in TFontData and TFont.

element.name: TFontQuality.fqDefault
element.short: Default font quality; used when appearance is not important.

element.name: TFontQuality.fqDraft
element.short: Prefer other font features (size, style) against output quality.
element.descr: Appearance of the font is less important than when fqProof is used. Generally offers lower quality than fqProof or fqDefault.

element.name: TFontQuality.fqProof
element.short: Prefer output quality against other font features (size, style).
element.descr: Font quality is more important exactly reproducing the size or style for the font.

element.name: TFontQuality.fqNonAntialiased
element.short: Disable font anti-aliasing.

element.name: TFontQuality.fqAntialiased
element.short: Use font anti-aliasing.
element.descr: The font is always anti-aliased when supported, and the font size is not too small or too large.

element.name: TFontQuality.fqCleartype
element.short: Use ClearType font anti-aliasing when available.

element.name: TFontQuality.fqCleartypeNatural
element.short: Use Clear Type Natural font anti-aliasing when available.

element.name: TFontData
element.short: Contains information about a font used in an application.

descr.p: TFontData is a record type used to hold information about a font in an application. It provides access to the system handle for the font, as well as attributes for the font. Values in the record are read from the font file when its handle is assigned, or when the default font from the widgetset interface is assigned.
TFontData is the type used to implement the FontData property in TFont.

element.name: TFontData.Handle
element.short: The Operating System Handle for the Font.

element.name: TFontData.Height
element.short: The Height (in pixels) for the Font.

element.name: TFontData.Pitch
element.short: The Pitch (layout style) for the Font.

element.name: TFontData.Style
element.short: The Style (or variant) for the Font.

descr.p: Style is a TFontStylesBase member which contains the style or variant for the typeface in a font. See TFontStyle for more information about the enumeration values and their meanings.

element.name: TFontData.CharSet
element.short: The character set for a Font as an Integer value.

descr.p: CharSet is a TFontCharSet member which stores an Integer identifier for a font character set. Its value identifies the character set or encoding supported in the font.

The actual value is specific to the Operating System and/or widgetset for the application. For the Windows platform, it corresponds to the value in TLogFont as retrieved from the Win32 GDI LogFont routine. Other platforms and widgetsets rely on the mechanism native to the interface like: X-Fonts, device contexts, or whatever API weirdness the Mac developers could dream up. The native values are translated to to the value represented in the member as an Integer.

element.name: TFontData.Quality
element.short: Output quality for the font.

descr.p: Quality is a TFontQuality member which contains an enumeration value which indicates the output quality for the font. The output quality determines how carefully font attributes are applied to output using the font.
See TFontQuality for more information about the enumeration values and their meanings.

element.name: TFontData.Name
element.short: The Name (as a string) of the current Font.

element.name: DefFontData
element.short: Default font data used for new TFont instances.

descr.p: New TFont instances are initialized with the values in this structure.
The default font is chosen by the interfaces depending on the context. For example, there can be a different default font for a button and a group box.

element.name: TTextLayout
element.short: Represents the text layout used to render text in its rectangle.

descr.p: TTextLayout is an enumerated type with values that indicate the layout used for text in its rectangle. TTextLayout is the type used to implement the Layout member in TTextStyle.

element.name: TTextLayout.tlTop
element.short: Text is aligned to the top of the text rectangle.

element.name: TTextLayout.tlCenter
element.short: Text is aligned to the center of the text rectangle.

element.name: TTextLayout.tlBottom
element.short: Text is aligned to the bottom of the text rectangle.

element.name: TTextStyle
element.short: The Style of the Text to be drawn in a rectangle.
element.descr: TTextStyle is a packed record type which contains setting used when a control draws text using TextOut or TextRect. It is used to save, restore and configure values needed for the canvas which renders a control.

element.name: TTextStyle.Alignment
element.short: Horizontal alignment in the text rectangle.

element.name: TTextStyle.Layout
element.short: Vertical alignment in the text rectangle.

element.name: TTextStyle.SingleLine
element.short: Indicates if the text is rendered as a single line.

descr.p: When set to True and WordBreak is False, CR (#13) and LF (#10) are handled as standard characters and do not result in line breaks.

element.name: TTextStyle.Clipping
element.short: Causes text to be clipped to the text rectangle.

element.name: TTextStyle.ExpandTabs
element.short: Causes Tab characters to be replaced with spaces.

descr.p: When set to True, occurrences of Tab (#9) characters are replaced with the appropriate number of space characters. The default value is 8.

element.name: TTextStyle.ShowPrefix
element.short: Draws a single Ampersand characters as an accelerator key decoration.

descr.p: When set to True, the first Ampersand (&) character on a line is drawn as the decoration used for an accelerator key. The character after the Ampersand contains the key for the accelerator. When True, double Ampersand (&&) characters are required to draw an Ampersand character in the text.

element.name: TTextStyle.Wordbreak
element.short: Causes a long line of text to be word-wrapped.

descr.p: When set to True, a line of text that is larger than the available width in the rectangle is word-wrapped into multiple lines at word boundaries.

element.name: TTextStyle.Opaque
element.short: Causes the output to be drawn with full opacity.

element.name: TTextStyle.SystemFont
element.short: Causes the system font to be used instead of the canvas font.

element.name: TTextStyle.RightToLeft
element.short: For RightToLeft text reading (text direction).

element.name: TTextStyle.EndEllipsis
element.short: Indicates if text is "ellipsified" when too long for its rectangle.

descr.p: If a line of text is too long to fit between left and right boundaries for the text rectangle, the text is shortened and an Ellipsis (...) is added to the end of the text value. Preference is given to WordBreak when set.

element.name: psSolid
element.short: Represents the solid pen style.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.psSolid enumeration value in the FCL.

element.name: psDash
element.short: Represents the dashed pen style.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.psDash enumeration value in the FCL.

element.name: psDot
element.short: Represents the dotted pen style.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.psDot enumeration value in the FCL.

element.name: psDashDot
element.short: Represents the dash-dot pattern pen style.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.psDashDot enumeration value in the FCL.

element.name: psDashDotDot
element.short: Represents the dash-dot-dot pattern pen style.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.psDashDotDot enumeration value in the FCL.

element.name: psClear
element.short: Represents the clear pen style.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.psClear enumeration value in the FCL.

element.name: psInsideframe
element.short: Represents the pen style used for an inside frame.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.psInsideframe enumeration value in the FCL.

element.name: psPattern
element.short: Represents a pattern pen style.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.psPattern enumeration value in the FCL.

element.name: pmBlack
element.short: Represents the Black pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmBlack enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are always set to black.

element.name: pmWhite
element.short: Represents the White pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmWhite enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are always set to white.

element.name: pmNop
element.short: Represents the No OP pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmNop enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are unchanged.

element.name: pmNot
element.short: Represents the NOT pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmNot enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse for the current color.

element.name: pmCopy
element.short: Represents the Copy pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmCopy enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to the pen color.

element.name: pmNotCopy
element.short: Represents the Not Copy pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmNotCopy enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse of the pen color.

element.name: pmMergePenNot
element.short: Represents the Merge Pen Not pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmMerge enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the pen color and the inverse of the pixel color.

element.name: pmMaskPenNot
element.short: Represents the Mask Pen Not pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmMaskPenNot enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to colors common to both the pen and the inverse of the pixel color.

element.name: pmMergeNotPen
element.short: Represents the Merge Not Pen pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmMergePenNot enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the pen color and the inverse of the pixel color.

element.name: pmMaskNotPen
element.short: Represents the Mask Not Pen pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmMaskNotPen enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the colors common to the inverse of the pen color and the current pixel color.

element.name: pmMerge
element.short: Represents the Merge pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmMerge enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the pen color and the current pixel color.

element.name: pmNotMerge
element.short: Represents the Not Merge pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmNotMerge enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse of the color derived using pmMerge pen mode.

element.name: pmMask
element.short: Represents the Mask pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmMask enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set a combination of the colors common to the pen color and the current pixel color.

element.name: pmNotMask
element.short: Represents the Not Mask pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmNotMask enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse of the color for pmMask pen mode.

element.name: pmXor
element.short: Represents the XOR pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmXor enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the pen color and the current pixel color, but not both.

element.name: pmNotXor
element.short: Represents the Not XOR pen mode.

descr.p: Alias for the FPCanvas.pmNotXor enumeration value in the FCL. Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse of the color using pmXor pen mode.

element.name: bsSolid
element.short: Represents the Solid brush style.

descr.p: Alias for the TFPBrushStyle.bsSolid enumeration value in the FCL. Fills a shape using the color for the brush.

element.name: bsClear
element.short: Represents the Clear brush style.

descr.p: Alias for the TFPBrushStyle.bsClear enumeration value in the FCL. Fills a shape with transparency (using the existing color as the fill color).

element.name: bsHorizontal
element.short: Represents the Horizontal brush style.

descr.p: Alias for the TFPBrushStyle.bsHorizontal enumeration value in the FCL. Fills a shape with a pattern consisting of equidistant horizontal lines.

element.name: bsVertical
element.short: Represents the Vertical brush style.

descr.p: Alias for the TFPBrushStyle.bsVertical enumeration value in the FCL. Fills a shape with a pattern consisting of equidistant vertical lines.

element.name: bsFDiagonal
element.short: Represents the FDiagonal brush style.

descr.p: Alias for the TFPBrushStyle.bsFDiagonal enumeration value in the FCL. Fills a shape with a pattern consisting of equidistant lines drawn with a 45-degree downward, left-to-right hatch.

element.name: bsBDiagonal
element.short: Represents the BDiagonal brush style.

descr.p: Alias for the TFPBrushStyle.bsBDiagonal enumeration value in the FCL. Fills a shape with a pattern consisting of equidistant lines drawn with a 45-degree upward, left-to-right hatch.

element.name: bsCross
element.short: Represents the Cross brush style.

descr.p: Alias for the TFPBrushStyle.bsCross enumeration value in the FCL. Fills a shape with a pattern consisting of equidistant lines drawn as a horizontal and vertical cross-hatch.

element.name: bsDiagCross
element.short: Represents the DiagCross brush style.

descr.p: Alias for the TFPBrushStyle.bsDiagCross enumeration value in the FCL. Fills a shape with a pattern consisting of equidistant lines drawn as a 45 degree cross-hatch.

element.name: pecRound
element.short: Represents the Round pen end cap.

element.name: pecSquare
element.short: Represents the Square pen end cap.

element.name: pecFlat
element.short: Represents the Flat pen end cap.

element.name: pjsRound
element.short: Represents the Round pen join style.

element.name: pjsBevel
element.short: Represents the Bevel pen join style.

element.name: pjsMiter
element.short: Represents the Miter pen join style.

descr.p: Alias for the TGraphicsFillStyle enumeration type in the FCL.

element.name: TFillMode
element.short: Represents Fill Mode values.

descr.p: Not used in the current LCL implementation. Appears to have been replaced with the LazRegionFillMode type in lazregions.pas.

element.name: TCopyMode
element.short: Type used to represent canvas copy modes.

descr.p: TCopyMode is an alias for the LongInt type. TCopyMode is the type used to implement the CopyMode property in TCanvas. Normally contains a value defined in the copy mode constants:

dl.dd: Fills the destination rectangle with the first color in the physical palette. (Black for the default palette).
Inverts colors in the destination rectangle.
Merges colors from the source rectangle with the brush color.
Merges inverted colors from the source rectangle with the colors in the destination rectangle using an OR operation.
Copies inverted colors from the source rectangle to the destination rectangle.
Combines the colors from the source and destination rectangles using an OR operation, and inverts the result.
Copies the brush into the destination rectangle.
Combines the brush colors with the colors in the destination rectangle using an XOR operation.
Combines the brush colors with the inverted colors from the source rectangle using an OR operation, and combines the result with the colors in the destination rectangle using an OR operation.
Combines colors from the source and destination rectangles using an AND operation.
Copies the source rectangle to the destination rectangle.
Combines the inverted colors in the destination rectangle with the colors from the source rectangle using an AND operation.
Combines the colors in the source and destination rectangles using an XOR operation.
Combines the colors in the source and destination rectangles using an OR operation.
Fills the destination rectangle using the second color in the physical palette. (White for the default palette).

descr.p: The default value for the propriety is cmSrcCopy.
Copy mode constants are omitted for the CAPTUREBLT and NOMIRRORBITMAP values used in the Windows GDI API.

element.name: TCanvasStates
element.short: Represents states values for TCanvas.

descr.p: TCanvasStates is an enumerated type with values that represent the state for a TCanvas instance. Value(s) from the enumeration are stored in the TCanvasState set type used to implement the State property in TCanvas.

element.name: TCanvasStates.csHandleValid
element.short: The handle for the canvas is valid.

element.name: TCanvasStates.csFontValid
element.short: Font properties correspond to the selected Font Handle in the Device Context (DC).

element.name: TCanvasState
element.short: Set type used to store TCanvasStates values.

element.name: TCanvasOrientation
element.short: Represents orientations for a canvas.
element.descr: Not used in the current LCL implementation.

element.name: TProgressStage
element.descr: Alias for the TFPImgProgressStage type in the FCL.

element.name: TProgressEvent
element.short: TProgressEvent - for monitoring the progress of a drawing process.
element.descr: Alias for the TFPImgProgressEvent type in the FCL.

element.name: TPixelFormat
element.short: Represents storage formats for pixels in image data.

descr.p: TPixelFormat is an enumerated type with values that represent the storage format for pixels in image data. In general, it indicates the number of bits required for each pixel in an image. It also determines the color spectrum and color depth available in image data.
TPixelFormat is the type used to implement the PixelFormat property in TRasterImage, TSharedCustomBitmap, TCustomBitmap, TSharedIcon, TIconImage, TCustomIcon, et. al.

element.name: TPixelFormat.pfDevice
element.short: Indicates that the source device determines the pixel format.

element.name: TPixelFormat.pf1bit
element.short: 1 bit per pixel. Monochrome.

element.name: TPixelFormat.pf4bit
element.short: 4 bits per pixel. 16 colors.

element.name: TPixelFormat.pf8bit
element.short: 8 bits per pixel. 256 colors.

element.name: TPixelFormat.pf15bit
element.short: 15 bits per pixel. 32,768 colors. Also called High Color.

element.name: TPixelFormat.pf16bit
element.short: 16 bits per pixel. 65,536 colors. Also referred to as High Color.

element.name: TPixelFormat.pf24bit
element.short: 24 bits per pixel. 16,777,216 colors. Also called TrueColor.

element.name: TPixelFormat.pf32bit
element.short: 32 bits per pixel. 4,294,967,296 colors. Not a common pixel format.

element.name: TPixelFormat.pfCustom
element.short: Uses a pixel format other than the defined values.

element.name: PIXELFORMAT_BPP
element.short: Constant with the number of bits per pixel for TPixelFormat enumeration values.

descr.p: PIXELFORMAT_BPP is a constant which contains an array of Byte values representing the number of bits used for pixel data in an image. Elements in the array are indexed values in the TPixelFormat enumeration, and contain the number of bits per pixel for the associated pixel format.

element.name: TTransparentMode
element.short: Represents transparency modes used in raster images.

element.name: TTransparentMode.tmAuto
element.short: Transparency is determined by examining a designated pixel in the image data.

element.name: TTransparentMode.tmFixed
element.short: Uses a designated color as the transparent color.

element.name: clBlack
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clMaroon
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clGreen
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clOlive
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clNavy
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clPurple
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clTeal
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clGray
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clSilver
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clRed
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clLime
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clYellow
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clBlue
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clFuchsia
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clAqua
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: clLtGray
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.
element.descr: An alias for clSilver.

element.name: clDkGray
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.
element.descr: An alias for clGray.

element.name: clWhite
element.short: One of the standard colors. Delphi compatible.

element.name: StandardColorsCount
element.short: Number of standard color definitions.

element.name: clMoneyGreen
element.short: One of the extended colors.

element.name: clSkyBlue
element.short: One of the extended colors.

element.name: clCream
element.short: One of the extended colors.

element.name: clMedGray
element.short: One of the extended colors.

element.name: clNone
element.short: One of the special colors.

element.name: clDefault
element.short: The default color of a given control.

descr.p: The default color for a given control. This color alone does not have any meaning; it needs to be resolved using a control instance and one of the methods like: TControl.GetDefaultColor, TControl.GetColorResolvingParent or TControl.GetRGBColorResolvingParent.

element.name: clScrollBar
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clBackground
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clActiveCaption
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clInactiveCaption
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clMenu
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clWindow
element.short: Background color for an edit control.

descr.p: The color of the background of a widget, for example a TEdit. This is usually white. Don't confuse this with the background of a window, or form, which is given by clForm.

element.name: clWindowFrame
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clMenuText
element.short: The color of the text in menus.

element.name: clWindowText
element.short: The color for the text in an edit control.

descr.p: The color of the text in a widget, such as for example TEdit. This is usually black. Don't confuse with the color of the window decoration caption or of a raised control such as buttons or anything else.

element.name: clCaptionText
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clActiveBorder
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clInactiveBorder
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clAppWorkspace
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clHighlight
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clHighlightText
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clBtnFace
element.short: Color for a button face.

descr.p: The color used for a button face. This color is also utilized in many other places for raised areas such as a panel.

element.name: clBtnShadow
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clGrayText
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clBtnText
element.short: The color for the text or other raised area on a button.

element.name: clInactiveCaptionText
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clBtnHighlight
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: cl3DDkShadow
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: cl3DLight
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clInfoText
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clInfoBk
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clHotLight
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clGradientActiveCaption
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clGradientInactiveCaption
element.short: One of the System colors.

element.name: clForm
element.short: Represents the color of the background for a form.

element.name: TGraphicsObject
element.short: Primitive ancestor class, mainly for Delphi compatibility.

descr.p: TGraphicsObject - In Delphi VCL this is the ancestor of TFont, TPen and TBrush. Since FPC 2.0 the LCL uses TFPCanvasHelper as ancestor.

element.name: TFontHandleCache.CompareDescriptors

element.name: TFontHandleCache.FindFontDesc

element.name: TFontHandleCache.Add

element.name: TFont
element.short: Represents a font used to draw text in an application.

descr.p: TFont is a TFPCustomFont descendant, and provides properties and methods needed to represent a font used in an LCL application.

Most of the information about the font is provided in a TFontData instance used in protected methods like GetData and SetData. Data items in the structure are exposed as properties, and includes: CharSet, Color, Height,Name, Orientation, Pitch, Quality, Size, and Style.
Its Reference property provides access to the font Handle in the widgetset implementation.

element.name: TFont.FreeReference
element.short: Frees the widgetset font reference in the class instance.

descr.p: FreeReference calls the inherited Changing method to signal the OnChanging event handler (when assigned). FreeReference ensures that a cache font handle for the font reference is removed from the FontResourceCache. If the font handle is not cached, the handle is deleted and the LCL handle in the font reference is set to 0 ( zero).
FreeReference is called from methods which set the value in font properties like: Name, Size, Pitch, Height, Style, and Orientation. It is also called when the class instance is freed.

element.name: TFont.Changed
element.short: Changed - checks for pending updates (if there are any, returns True) or calls inherited Changed.

descr.p: Changed is an overridden procedure used to maintain the internal state for the class instance. If Changed has already been called for the font instance, no additional actions are required or performed. Otherwise, the inherited method is called to signal the OnChanged event handler (when assigned).

Changed is called when any of the properties for the font are modified, or when a new value is assigned to FontData or PixelsPerInch. Changed is called from the EndUpdate method when the internal update count reaches 0 (zero).

element.short:
DoAllocateResources - calls inherited method then calls
GetReference.

element.short: DoCopyProps - calls inherited method; if From argument is another Font, copies specified properties directly.

element.name: TFont.DoDeAllocateResources

element.name: TFont.SetFlags
element.short: Sets the value for an indexed style flag.

descr.p: SetFlags is an overridden method used to set the value for an individual style flag by its ordinal position.
Index contains the position for the style flag used in the canvas helper for the class.
AValue is a Boolean value that indicates whether the TFontStyle value is included in or excluded from the style flags.
SetFlags is called when a new value is assigned to the Style property differs from the existing value.

element.name: TFont.SetFlags.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the style flag updated in the method.

element.name: TFont.SetFlags.AValue

element.name: TFont.SetFPColor
element.short: Sets the font Color to the specified TFPColor value.

descr.p: SetFPColor is a method used to set the Color for the font to the value specified in AValue. AValue contains a TFPColor value as defined in the FCL. SetFPColor calls FPColorToTColor to convert AValue to the TColor value applied to the Color property.

element.name: TFont.SetFPColor.AValue
element.short: TFPColor value applied to the Color property.

descr.p: Any change to Height is also converted to Points and applied to Size.

element.name: TFont.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor in TFont. Create calls the inherited constructor on entry, and sets the default values for properties including:

dl.dd: Set to clDefault for platforms or widgetsets where it is enabled. Otherwise, set to clWindowText.
Set to the value in DefFontData.
Set to the value in DefFontData.
Set to the value in DefFontData.
Set to the value in DefFontData.
Set to the value in DefFontData.
Set to the vertical display density used in ScreenInfo.
Calculated using values in Height and PixelsPerInch. Applied by calling the SetSize method inherited from TFPCustomFont.
Set to the value in DefFontData, and applied by calling the SetName name method inherited from TFPCustomFont.
Calls the SetFPColor method inherited from TFPCanvasHelper to set the font color to colBlack.

descr.p: The DelayAllocate property from the TFPCanvasHelper ancestor is set to True to defer resource allocation for the Canvas until it is used.

element.name: TFont.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy calls FreeReference to free cached font resources for the Reference class, and frees the Handle for the font. The inherited destructor is called prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TFont.Assign
element.short: Copies values from Source to the current class instance.

descr.p: Assign is an overridden method used to copy values from the specified Source into the current class instance. Overloaded variants are provided that allow the source to be a TPersistent instance (which is cast to TFont) or a TLogFont record instance.

element.name: TFont.Assign.Source
element.short: Persistent object with values stored in the method.

element.name: TFont.Assign.ALogFont
element.short: Logical font resource with values stored in the method.

element.name: TFont.BeginUpdate
element.short: Starts an update process for the class instance.

element.name: TFont.EndUpdate
element.short: Finishes an update process for the class instance.

element.name: TFont.FontData
element.short: Contains the data describing the font.

element.name: TFont.HandleAllocated
element.short: HandleAllocated - returns True if a handle has been allocated.

element.name: TFont.Handle
element.short: Operating system Handle for the Font.

descr.p: Operating system Handle for the Font.

element.name: TFont.IsDefault
element.short: IsDefault - returns True if this is the default Font.

element.name: TFont.IsEqual
element.short: IsEqual - returns True if this Font is the same as the specified Font.

element.name: TFont.IsEqual.Result
element.short: True when the font matches the one in the current class instance.

element.name: TFont.IsEqual.AFont
element.short: Font instance to compare to the current class instance.

element.name: TFont.IsMonoSpace
element.short: Indicates if the font uses fixed-width characters (monospace).

descr.p: IsMonoSpace is a read-only Boolean property which indicates if the font is a monospaced font with a fixed character width. The FontIsMonoSpace routine from the LCL interface is called to get the property value, and uses the font handle in Reference to retrieve the font data.

element.name: TFont.SetDefault
element.short: Sets font properties to their default values.

descr.p: SetDefault is a procedure used to set properties in the font to the values used in the DefFontData variable. SetDefault calls BeginUpdate to start an update process, and sets the values for the following properties:
Color is set to clDefault when the UseCLDefault compiler directive is defined. Otherwise, the value clWindowText is used in the property.
EndUpdate is called to finish the update process prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TFont.PixelsPerInch
element.short: Display density for the font.

descr.p: PixelsPerInch is an Integer property which indicates the display density (or pixels per inch) for the font.

The default value for the property is set when the class instance is created, and uses the value from the PixelsPerInchY member in ScreenInfo. It is also updated when Assign is used to copy property values from another font instance.
PixelsPerInch is used when values are assigned to the Height or Size properties to convert pixel values to the Points unit of measure used in Size.
Setting a new value in PixelsPerInch causes Height to be scaled to the new value for the property. Changed is also called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TFont.Reference
element.short: Reference - References made to this Font.

descr.p: Reference is a read-only TWSFontReference property which contains a reference to the widgetset class used for the font instance. It provides access to the Handle for the font resource, and is used in methods that need access to an existing font handle.
Resources for the property are allocated (when needed) and initialized by calling the ReferenceNeeded method. The resources are freed in the FreeReference method.

element.name: TFont.CharSet
element.short: Indicates the character set used in the font.

descr.p: CharSet is a TFontCharSet property which contains a numeric value representing the character set in the font instance. The default value for the property is defined in the DEFAULT_CHARSET constant, and indicates that the default character set for the operating system or platform is used.
Setting a new value for the property causes the font Reference class to be re-created, and Changed is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
CharSet is updated when the font data is read for the class instance, and when Assign is called to copy values from another font instance.

element.name: TFont.Color
element.short: Color used to render text using the font.

descr.p: Color is a TColor property which contains the color used to render text using the font. The default value for the property is clDefault when the UseCLDefault compiler directive is defined. Otherwise, the default value is clWindowText.
Setting a new value for the property causes the ancestor class to be notified, and Changed is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TFont.Height
element.short: Height for the font (in pixels).

descr.p: Height is an Integer property which contains the height for the font in pixels. The property value is not stored during LCL streaming operations when its value is the same as the value in DefFontData.

Setting a new value for the property causes the font handle in Reference to be re-created. Size is also updated with the new property value converted to Points (1/72 of an inch). Changed is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
Use Size to read or write the height for the font as a number of Points (1/72 inch).

element.name: TFont.Name
element.short: Name of the font.

descr.p: Name is a String property which contains the name of the font in the class instance. The initial value for the property is set when the class instance is created, and uses the Name from the DefFontData variable. The property is updated when Assign is called to copy values from another font instance.
Setting a new value for the property causes the font Reference to be re-created, and the Changed method is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
Name is not included in LCL streaming when the property value is the same as the Name member in DefFontData.

element.name: TFont.Orientation
element.short: Rotation for the current font in 1/10ths of a degree.

descr.p: Orientation is an Integer property which contains the rotation angle used for text in 1/10ths of a degree. The rotation angle is determined by the relationship between the X Axis for the Canvas and the baseline for the font, and uses the following directionality:

tr.td: Text is drawn horizontally from left to right.
Text is drawn vertically from bottom to top.
Text is drawn upside down from right to left.
Text is drawn vertically from top to bottom.

descr.p: Setting a new value for the property causes the font Reference to be re-created, and calls Changes to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
The default value for the property is 0 (zero).

element.name: TFont.Pitch
element.short: Pitch type of the Font.

descr.p: Pitch is a TFontPitch property which indicates the pitch for the font face.
Setting a new value for the property causes the font Reference to be re-created, and the Changed method is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TFont.Quality
element.short: Output quality for the Font, such as anti-aliasing.

descr.p: Quality is a TFontQuality property which contains a value with the output quality for the font. The output quality determines how carefully font attributes are applied to output using the font.
The default value for the property is fqDefault. See TFontQuality for more information about the enumeration values and their meanings.
Setting a new value for the property causes the font Reference to be re-created, and Changed is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TFont.Size
element.short: Vertical size for the font in Points.

descr.p: Size is an Integer property which contains the height for the font in Points (1/72 of an inch). The value in Size is calculated using the logical font height, and is not read or written in LCL component streaming.

Setting a new value for the property causes the font Reference to be re-created for the class instance. The new value is stored by calling SetSize in the ancestor class. The new value is also converted to pixels (using PixelsPerInch) and stored in the Height property.

element.name: TFont.Style
element.short: Styles applied to the font face.

descr.p: Style is a TFontStyles property which indicates the font styles applied to the font face. The Style set contains 0 (zero ) or more values from the TFontStyle enumeration, including:

dl.dd: Bold font style
Italic font style
Strike-out (or strike-through) font style
Underline font style

descr.p: The default value for the property is an empty set ([]), and indicates that no styles are applied to the font face.
Setting a new value for the property causes the font Reference to be re-created. The Change method is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TPenStyle
element.short: Represents line drawing styles used when rendering to a canvas.

descr.p: TPenStyle is an alias for the TFPPenStyle type in the FCL.

element.name: TPenMode
element.short: Represents pen modes used when rendering to a canvas.

descr.p: TPenMode is an alias for the TFPPenMode type in the FCL.

element.name: TPenEndCap
element.short: Represents end cap styles used for a pen.

descr.p: TPenEndCap is an enumerated typed with values representing geometric shapes used as end caps for a pen. End caps are applied to the starting and ending points in a line segment.
TPenEndCap is the type used to implement the EndCap property in TPen.

element.name: TPenEndCap.pecRound
element.short: Rounded end cap which extends beyond the point.

element.name: TPenEndCap.pecSquare
element.short: Rectangular end cap which extends beyond the point.

element.name: TPenEndCap.pecFlat
element.short: Flat (or blunt) end cap which does not extend beyond the point.

element.name: TPenJoinStyle
element.short: Represents join styles used between line segments.

element.name: TPenJoinStyle.pjsRound
element.short: Round shape used at the join points.

element.name: TPenJoinStyle.pjsBevel
element.short: Bevel shape used at the join points.

element.name: TPenJoinStyle.pjsMiter
element.short: Mitered angular shape used at join points.

element.name: TPenPattern
element.short: Represents a pattern brush for a pen.

descr.p: TPenPattern is an array type used to store the sequence of LongWord values that make up the pattern. TPenPattern is essentially a user-defined pen style.
TPenPattern is the type used to implement the Pattern property in TPen.

element.name: TPenHandleCacheDescriptor
element.short: Cache descriptor for Pen Handles.

element.name: TPenHandleCacheDescriptor.ExtPen
element.short: Extended logical pen structure for the cache entry.

element.name: TPenHandleCacheDescriptor.Pattern
element.short: The Pattern for this pen.

element.name: TPenHandleCache
element.short: TPenHandleCache - Resource Cache for Pen Handles.

element.name: TPenHandleCache.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TPenHandleCache.CompareDescriptors
element.short: Compares the specified image descriptors to determine if they have the same pens and pattern data.

element.name: TPenHandleCache.FindPen
element.short: FindPen - returns a ResourceCacheItem corresponding to the nominated Handle.

element.name: TPenHandleCache.FindPenDesc
element.short: FindPenDesc - returns a descriptor for the given pen and pattern.

element.name: TPenHandleCache.Add
element.short: Add - returns a cache descriptor corresponding to the pen that has been added to the cache.

element.name: TPen
element.short: Represents a pen used to draw on a canvas.

descr.p: TPen is a TFPCustomPen descendant which contains settings for a pen used to draw lines and shapes on a canvas. It includes properties that define the color for the pen, the end cap and join style used for line segments, and a pattern used for user-defined line drawing styles.
Essentially, TPen maps the types used for properties in the FCL ancestor class to the types used in the LCL.
TPen is the type used to implement the Pen property in TCanvas.

element.name: TPen.FreeReference
element.short: Frees the Pen class reference and optionally removes it from the Pen resource cache.

element.name: TPen.GetHandle
element.short: Gets the value for the Handle property.

element.name: TPen.GetHandle.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TPen.GetReference
element.short: Gets the value for the Reference property.

element.name: TPen.GetReference.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TPen.ReferenceNeeded
element.short: Ensures that the Reference class is allocated and initialized.

element.name: TPen.SetCosmetic
element.short: Sets the value for the Cosmetic property.

element.name: TPen.SetCosmetic.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TPen.SetHandle
element.short: Sets the value for the Handle property.

element.name: TPen.SetHandle.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TPen.DoAllocateResources
element.short: Performs actions needed to allocate resources for the class instance.

descr.p: DoAllocateResources is an overridden method used to allocate resources for the class instance. DoAllocateResources calls the inherited method , and calls GetReference to initialize the Reference property used in the class instance.

element.name: TPen.DoDeAllocateResources
element.short: Performs actions to free resources allocated for the class instance.

descr.p: Overridden. Calls FreeReference. Calls the inherited method.

element.name: TPen.DoCopyProps
element.short: Copies properties from the specified source to the class instance.

descr.p: Overridden. Provides support for the TPen type in the From parameter. Calls the inherited method.

element.name: TPen.DoCopyProps.From
element.short: Canvas helper descendant with properties copied in the method.

element.name: TPen.SetColor
element.short: Sets the value for the Color property.

element.name: TPen.SetColor.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TPen.SetFPColor
element.short: Sets the pen Color to the specified TFPColor value.

descr.p: SetFPColor is a method used to set the Color for the pen to the value specified in AValue. AValue contains a TFPColor value as defined in the FCL. SetFPColor calls FPColorToTColor to convert AValue to the TColor value applied to the Color property.

element.name: TPen.SetEndCap
element.short: SetEndCap - specified the type of end cap to be used for the pen, if it is a geometric pen.

descr.p: Defined for FCL versions where the EndCap property is implemented.

element.name: TPen.SetEndCap.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.short: Sets the value for the JoinStyle property.

descr.p: SetJoinStyle - specifies the style to be used by the geometric pen when lines join (at corners etc).

element.name: TPen.SetJoinStyle.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.short: Sets the value for the Mode property.
element.descr: Overridden write access specifier.

element.name: TPen.SetMode.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TPen.SetStyle
element.short: Sets the value for the Style property.

descr.p: Overridden write access specifier.

element.name: TPen.SetStyle.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TPen.SetWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the Width property.

descr.p: Overridden write access specifier.

element.name: TPen.SetWidth.value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TPen.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for TPen. It calls the inherited Create method, and sets the default values for properties including:

element.name: TPen.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for TPen. It frees resource in Reference and calls the inherited Destroy method.

element.name: TPen.Assign
element.short: Copies property values from the specified persistent object.

descr.p: Assign is an overridden method used to copy property values from the persistent object in Source to the current class instance.

Source is the TPersistent class instance with the property values copied in the method. If Source is a TPen instance, the properties introduced in TPen are copied into the current class instance. Otherwise, the inherited method is called.

element.name: TPen.Assign.Source
element.short: Persistent object with values copied in the method.

element.name: TPen.Handle
element.short: The Operating System Handle for the current Pen.

descr.p: Handle is a HPEN property with the handle allocated for the pen by the operating system or widgetset. Setting a new value for the property causes the pen Reference to be re-created. The Changed method is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
descr.remark: The Handle property has been marked as deprecated. Use the Reference property to access the Handle for the pen.

element.name: TPen.Reference
element.short: A Reference made to this Pen.

descr.p: Reference is a read-only TWSPenReference property which provides a reference to the class allocated for the pen by a widgetset class. Use Reference to access the handle allocated for the pen resource.

element.name: TPen.GetPattern
element.short: Gets the Pattern used in the Pen.

descr.p: GetPattern is a TPenPattern function used to get Pattern for the pen. Use SetPattern to assign the Pattern used for the pen.
descr.remark: Please note that the Pattern property in the TFPCustomPen ancestor class uses a different type (LongWord instead of TPenPattern).

element.name: TPen.SetPattern
element.short: SetPattern - specifies the pattern for the pen.

descr.p: SetPattern is a reintroduced procedure in TPen to use the TPenPattern type. The property in the ancestor class uses the LongWord type.

element.name: TPen.Color
element.short: The Color of the current Pen.

descr.p: Color is a TColor property which contains the color used by the pen to draw on a canvas. The default value for the property is clBlack.

element.name: TPen.Cosmetic
element.short: Whether the Pen is Cosmetic, or non-geometric.

descr.p: Cosmetic is a Boolean property which indicates whether the pen is a Cosmetic one. When set to False, it is a Geometric Pen.

A Pen can be either Cosmetic or Geometric. A cosmetic pen is always 1 pixel wide, while a geometric pen can have any width. The width of a geometric pen is defined in world units and thus depends on transforms (scaling, rotation, shear, reflection) applied to a canvas. Operations using a cosmetic pen are faster.
The default value for the property is True.
Setting a new value for the property causes the pen Reference to be re-created. The Changed method is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TPen.EndCap
element.short: The sort of EndCap used on the Pen.

descr.p: The end cap can be Round, Square or Flat. When end caps are round, the last points are drawn round. When end caps are square, the last points are drawn square. When end caps are flat, the last points are not drawn at all.

element.name: TPen.JoinStyle
element.short: JoinStyle - the style of joint where two lines meet or cross.

descr.p: The join style can be: Round, Bevel or Miter. When style is Round, then line joins are round. When style is Bevel, then line joins are beveled. When style is Miter, then line joins are mitered.

element.name: TPen.Mode
element.short: Pen mode for the class instance.

descr.p: Mode is a TFPPenMode property which contains the pen mode used in the class instance. A pen mode indicates the raster operation performed to combine the pen color with existing pixels in the destination bitmap. Mode can contain any of the values:

dl.dd: Pixels affected by the pen are always set to black.
Pixels affected by the pen are always set to white.
Pixels affected by the pen are unchanged.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse for the current color.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to the pen color.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse of the pen color.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the pen color and the inverse of the pixel color.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to colors common to both the pen and the inverse of the pixel color.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the pen color and the inverse of the pixel color.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the colors common to the inverse of the pen color and the current pixel color.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the pen color and the current pixel color.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse of the color derived using pmMerge pen mode.
Pixels affected by the pen are set a combination of the colors common to the pen color and the current pixel color.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse of the color for pmMask pen mode.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to a combination of the pen color and the current pixel color, but not both.
Pixels affected by the pen are set to the inverse of the color using pmXor pen mode.

descr.p: The default value is pmCopy.

element.name: TPen.Style
element.short: Contains the line drawing style for the pen.

descr.p: Style is a TPenStyle property with the style used to draw lines with the Pen, and can contain one of the following values:
psDash, psDot, psDashDot, and psDashDotDot are drawn using the corresponding TPenPattern for the Style. On the Windows platform, these styles are not available if the Width is any value other than 1.

psInsideFrame uses a solid drawing style, and a Color dithered to one of the values in the color table for the device. The content drawn with the pen is reduced in size so that it appears inside of a bounding rectangle including the Width for the pen.
psClear, in general, tells the implementing class or routine that the drawing operation is not needed.
The default value for the property is psSolid. Setting a new value for the property cause the Changed method to be called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TPen.Width
element.short: Width for the Pen.

descr.p: Width is an Integer property which contains the width for the pen.

Setting a new value for the property causes the pen Reference to be re-created. The Changed method is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned). The default value for the property is 1.
Width is related to the Cosmetic property. A cosmetic pen has a width of 1. Setting Width to a value larger than 1 prevents using it as a cosmetic pen.

element.name: TBrushStyle
element.short: Represents the pattern for a Brush.

descr.p: TBrushStyle is an alias for TFPBrushStyle from the FCL. Brush style constants are defined in the LCL, and includes:

element.name: TBrushHandleCache
element.short: TBrushHandleCache - resource cache for Brush Handles.

element.short: Deletes the widgetset object with the handle in Item and removes it from the resource cache.

element.name: TBrushHandleCache.RemoveItem.Item
element.short: Item removed from the cache.

element.name: TBrushHandleCache.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TBrush
element.short: The Brush to be used to Paint on the current Canvas.

descr.p: A Brush is typically used to fill an enclosed area on theCanvas with one particular color or colored pattern.

element.name: TBrush.FreeReference
element.short: Frees the widgetset reference for the Brush.

element.name: TBrush.GetHandle
element.short: Gets the value for the Handle property.

element.name: TBrush.GetReference
element.short: Gets the value for the Reference property.

element.name: TBrush.GetColor
element.short: Gets the value for the Color property.

element.name: TBrush.ReferenceNeeded
element.short: Ensures that resources are allocated for the Reference property.

element.short: Sets the value for the Handle property.

element.name: TBrush.SetHandle.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TBrush.DoChange
element.short: Performs action needed when the Brush is changed.

element.name: TBrush.DoAllocateResources
element.short: DoAllocateResources - calls inherited method then calls GetReference.

element.name: TBrush.DoDeAllocateResources
element.short: DoDeAllocateResources - frees reference then calls inherited method.

element.name: TBrush.DoCopyProps
element.short: DoCopyProps - if the Fromargument is another Brush, frees reference before calling inherited method, then sets the Changed property.

element.name: TBrush.SetColor
element.short: Sets the value for the Color property.

descr.p: An overloaded variant provides both TColor and TFPColor values. It is used to set the color by calling the SetFPColor method in the ancestor class. No actions are performed in the method when the values in Color and FPColor have not been changed and the brush Style contains bsClear.

Frees the brush handle in the References property, and sets the value in Bitmap to Nil. Calls the inherited SetStyle method when Style is bsClear. Calls Changed to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TBrush.SetColor.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TBrush.SetColor.NewColor
element.short: TColor value applied to the brush Color.

element.name: TBrush.SetColor.NewFPColor
element.short: TFPColor value applied to the brush Color.

element.name: TBrush.SetFPColor
element.short: Sets the Brush color to the specified TFPColor value.

descr.p: SetFPColor is an overridden method used to set the color using the TFPColor value in AValue. Calls FPColorToTColor to convert AValue to a TColor value, and applies it to the Color property.

element.name: TBrush.SetFPColor.AValue
element.short: Color value applied to the Color property.

element.name: TBrush.SetBitmap
element.short: Sets the value for the Bitmap property.

element.name: TBrush.SetBitmap.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TBrush.SetStyle
element.short: Sets the value for the Style property.

element.name: TBrush.SetStyle.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TBrush.Assign
element.short: Copies values from Source to the current brush instance.

descr.p: Assign is a procedure used to copy properties values from Source to the current brush instance.

element.name: TBrush.Assign.Source
element.short: Brush instance with values copied in the method.

element.name: TBrush.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor on entry, and sets the default values for properties including:

dl.dd: Set to Nil.
Set to clWhite. The inherited SetFPColor method is called to apply the new value.
The default value is bsSolid, and the inherited SetStyle method is called to apply the value in ancestor classes.

descr.p: Create sets the value in DelayAllocate to True to defer resource allocation until the brush is used. The internal counter used to track updates is reset.

element.name: TBrush.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy frees the handle for the brush in the Reference property, and calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TBrush.EqualsBrush
element.short: Compares the specified Brush to the current class instance.

element.name: TBrush.EqualsBrush.Result
element.short: True when the brush properties match the values in the current class instance.

element.name: TBrush.EqualsBrush.ABrush
element.short: Brush instance compared to the current class.

element.name: TBrush.Bitmap
element.short: Bitmap with the pattern for the Brush.

descr.p: Bitmap is a TCustomBitmap property which contains the pattern used to draw the brush, and is generally used to fill shapes or rectangular areas.

When assigned, the Bitmap image is used to draw the brush pattern instead of using the Style for brush. Setting a value for the property causes values in Color and Style to be reset. Color is set to clWhite, and the brush Style is set to bsSolid. The Handle for the brush is freed, and the Changed method is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
The image in Bitmap will be discarded when a new value is assigned to the Style property.

element.name: TBrush.Handle
element.short: Operating System handle for the brush.

descr.p: Handle is a HBRUSH property which contains the handle allocated for the brush.
descr.remark: Handle has been marked as deprecated. Use the Reference property to access the handle for the brush.

element.name: TBrush.Reference
element.short: Contains a Reference to the handle allocated for the Brush.

descr.p: Reference is a read-only TWSBrushReference property which contains a reference to the widgetset class used for the brush instance. It provides access to the Handle allocated for the brush resource, and is used in methods that need access to an existing brush handle.
Resources for the property are allocated (when needed) and initialized by calling the ReferenceNeeded method. The resources are freed in the FreeReference method.

element.name: TBrush.Color
element.short: The Color of the current Brush.

descr.p: Color is a TColor property with the color used to draw the brush pattern indicated in the Style property. It is the background or fill color when Style contains bsSolid. Color is not used when Style is set to bsClear; in fact, the brush style in TFPCustomBrush ancestor is actually set to bsSolid.
Setting a new value for the property causes an existing brush handle in Reference to be freed, and the pattern image in Bitmap is discarded.
The default value for the property is clWhite. The default property value is restored when a new value is assigned to the Bitmap property.

element.name: TBrush.Style
element.short: Indicates the pattern drawn for the brush.

descr.p: Style is a TFPBrushStyle property which indicates the pattern drawn using the brush. Style contains one of the enumeration values defined in the FCL. The enumeration values are introduced as constants in the LCL, and includes:

Setting a new value in Style causes the brush Handle in Reference to be freed. The image in Bitmap is also discarded by setting the member to Nil. The Changed method is called to signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
The default value for the property is bsSolid. The value in Style is automatically set to bsSolid when a value is assigned to the Bitmap property.

element.name: TRegionOperations

element.name: TRegion
element.short: A defined area on a screen or canvas used to render a graphic image or text output.

descr.p: TRegion is a TGraphicsObject descendant which represents shaped areas that can be drawn, filled, or examined on a screen or canvas. The shaped areas can be one or more rectangles, and can overlap.

Use AddRectangle to create and combine a new rectangular area with the existing areas in the region. Each region has a Handle which identifies the construct. It is modified when a new rectangular area is added to the region.
TRegion is the type used to implement the Region propriety in TCanvas, and passed as an argument to the SetShape method in TWinControl.
descr.remark: Some operating systems and widgetsets allow regions to be defined with ellipses, rounded rectangles, and polygons as the sub-regions. TRegion is limited to the rectangle with the area that is the bounding box for a shape. See TLazRegion in LazRegions.pas and TLazCanvas in LazCanvas.pas for alternate implementations that provide these capabilities.

element.name: TRegion.AddOperation

element.name: TRegion.ClearSubRegions

element.short: Convenience routine to add a rectangle to the region.

descr.p: Gets a handle for the rectangular defined by the opposing corners with the X1, Y1, X2, and Y2 coordinates. The new region handle is OR'd with the existing handle for the region.
Calls ReferenceNeeded to ensure that the handle for the region has been allocated.
Discards the new region handle by calling DeleteObject.

element.name: TGraphic
element.short: Abstract base class used for images in supported image formats.

descr.p: The TGraphic class is an abstract base class for graphic images in image formats supported in the LCL. TGraphic establishes an API that is used in the LCL to read and write image data using a file, stream, resource, or the clipboard. Many of its methods are defined as virtual and/or abstract, and must be implemented (or re-implemented) in descendent classes to provide support for specific image formats.
Methods defined in TGraphic include:

TGraphic does not contain a mechanism for displaying or rendering an image. This capability is implemented in descendent classes which provide a TCanvas suitable for the image data, such as: TRasterImage, TBitmap, TIcon, TPixmap, TJPegImage, TGifImage, et. al.
Properties common to most image formats are defined in the class, and include:
Event handlers are provided for change and progress notifications, including:
TGraphic is the type used to implement the Graphic property in TPicture, and passed as an argument to methods in TCanvas.

element.name: TGraphic.Changed
element.short: Performs action needed when the image data has changed.

descr.p: Changed is a procedure used to perform actions needed when the image data for the class instance has been changed. Changed sets the value in Modified to True, and signals the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
Changed is called when the value in Modified is changed from False to True.

element.name: TGraphic.Changed.Sender
element.short: Object for the change notification.

element.name: TGraphic.Equals
element.short: Determines if the specified class instance is the same as the current class instance.

element.name: TGraphic.Equals.Result
element.short: True when the specified object the same instance as the current class.

element.name: TGraphic.Equals.Graphic
element.short: TGraphics instance compared in the method.

element.name: TGraphic.Equals.Obj
element.short: TObject instance compared in the method.

element.name: TGraphic.DefineProperties
element.short: DefineProperties finds out whether the object really is a binary (graphic).

descr.p: Ensures that ReadData and WriteData are used to read the binary values for image data in TGraphic instances. Calls the DefineBinaryProperty method in Filer to set the read and write procedures for the data.

element.name: TGraphic.DefineProperties.Filer
element.short: TFiler instance used to read and write property values during component streaming.

element.name: TGraphic.Draw
element.short: Method to Draw the Graphic on the specified Canvas, in the specified Rectangle.

descr.p: Draw is an abstract virtual procedure used to render data in the graphic to the specified Canvas using the given coordinate rectangle. Draw must be implemented in a descendent class to perform actions required for a specific image format.
Canvas is the TCanvas instance where the graphic is rendered.
Rect is a TRect instance with the coordinates where graphic is drawn on the Canvas.

element.name: TGraphic.Draw.ACanvas
element.short: Canvas used to render the graphic.

element.name: TGraphic.Draw.Rect
element.short: Canvas coordinates where the graphic is drawn.

element.name: TGraphic.GetEmpty
element.short: Gets the value for the Empty property.

descr.p: GetEmpty is an abstract virtual Boolean function used to get the value for the Empty property. The return value is True when no image data exists for the graphic.
GetEmpty must be implemented in a descendent class to provide support for a specific image format.

element.name: TGraphic.GetEmpty.Result
element.short: True when no data exists in the graphic.

element.name: TGraphic.GetHeight
element.short: Gets the value for the Height property.

element.name: TGraphic.GetHeight.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TGraphic.GetMimeType
element.short: Gets the value for the MimeType property.

element.name: TGraphic.GetPalette
element.short: Gets the value for the Palette property.

descr.p: Always returns 0 (representing an unassigned handle) in TGraphic.

element.name: TGraphic.GetPalette.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TGraphic.GetTransparent
element.short: Gets the value for the Transparent property.

element.name: TGraphic.GetTransparent.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TGraphic.GetWidth
element.short: Gets the value for the Width property.

element.name: TGraphic.GetWidth.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TGraphic.Progress
element.short: Monitor the Progress of the drawing.

descr.p: Progress is an overloaded procedure used to perform actions needed for progress notifications for the class instance. Arguments passed to the method identify the class instance, the progress step, the completion amount, and display options for the notification.
Progress signals the OnProgress event handler (when assigned) using the parameter values as arguments. Applications must implement an OnProgress event handler to respond to the progress notification.
Progress is a virtual method, and can be overridden in a descendent class to preform any actions needed when reading or writing image data for a specific image format.
descr.remark: Please note the data type used for the PercentDone argument. It is declared as a Byte type, and will accept a value that exceeds 100.

element.name: TGraphic.Progress.Sender
element.short: Object for the notification.

element.name: TGraphic.Progress.Stage
element.short: Indicates whether an operation is starting, running, or ending.

element.name: TGraphic.Progress.PercentDone
element.short: Completion percentage for the progress step.

element.name: TGraphic.Progress.RedrawNow
element.short: Indicates if the application should redraw the image.

element.name: TGraphic.Progress.R

element.name: TGraphic.ReadData

descr.p: ReadData is a procedure used to read binary data for the graphic from the specified stream. It is used by the TFiler instance which loads data during component streaming.
ReadData calls LoadFromStream to complete the operation.

element.name: TGraphic.ReadData.Stream
element.short: TStream instance where data for the graphic is stored.

element.name: TGraphic.SetHeight

descr.p: SetHeight is an abstract virtual method, and must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TGraphic.SetHeight.Value

element.name: TGraphic.SetPalette

descr.p: SetPalette is an empty implementation in TGraphic.

element.name: TGraphic.SetPalette.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TGraphic.SetTransparent
element.short: Sets the value for the Transparent property.

descr.p: SetTransparent is an abstract virtual method, and must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TGraphic.SetTransparent.Value
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TGraphic.SetWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the Width property.

descr.p: SetWidth is an abstract virtual method, and must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TGraphic.SetWidth.Value
