InitializeReader ensures that AReader is derived from TLazReaderBMP. No additional actions are performed in the method when AReader is not a TLazReaderBMP class instance.
InitializeReader applies values from the TransparentMode and TransparentColor properties to the mask settings in AReader.
Determines whether the transparency color is auto-detected in the image data, or a fixed transparency color is used.

dl.dd: The bottom left pixel in the image data contains the transparency color.
Uses a predefined color in TransparentColor as the transparency color.

descr.p: Determines the color used to represent transparent areas in the image data.

dl.dd: Uses the bottom left pixel as the transparency color. This is a Lazarus extension.
Ignores transparency in the image data. This is a Lazarus extension.

descr.p: All other color constants represent the color for transparent pixels in the image.
Values in TransparentMode and TransparentColor are assigned to the MaskMode and MaskColor properties in AReader as required.

element.name: TBitmap.InitializeReader.AImage
element.short: Provides access to the raw data for the image.

element.name: TBitmap.InitializeReader.AReader
element.short: Reader used to access raw data for the image.

element.name: TBitmap.GetReaderClass
element.short: Gets the class reference used to create the FCL-compatible reader for the image.

descr.p: GetReaderClass is an overridden TFPCustomImageReaderClass class function used to get the FCL-compatible reader for the image type. The return value is a TLazReaderBMP class reference in TBitmap.

GetReaderClass is called from the ReadStream method when the reader is created and initialized. It is used to load a TLazIntfImage instance with the image content supplied in a stream. It is also used in the IsStreamFormatSupported method to determine if the stream contains an image format that can be read using the reader class type.

element.name: TBitmap.GetReaderClass.Result
element.short: Class reference used to create instances of the reader class.

element.name: TBitmap.GetWriterClass
element.short: Gets the class reference used to create instances of the FCL-compatible image writer.

descr.p: The return value is a TLazWriterBMP class reference in TBitmap.
GetWriterClass is called from the WriteStream method when the image writer is used to write a TLazIntfImage instance to a stream.

element.name: TBitmap.GetWriterClass.Result
element.short: Class reference used to create instances of the writer class.

element.name: TBitmap.GetSharedImageClass
element.short: Gets the class reference used to create new instances of a shared image.

descr.p: GetSharedImageClass provides a class reference used to create new instances of the shared image class used in TBitmap.
The return value is a TSharedBitmap class reference in TBitmap.
GetSharedImageClass is called from methods like Create, Assign, and CanShareImage.

element.name: TBitmap.GetSharedImageClass.Result
element.short: Class reference used to create new instances of the shared image class.

element.name: TBitmap.GetFileExtensions
element.short: Gets the file extensions supported for the image type.

descr.p: GetFileExtensions is an overridden String class function used to get a delimited list of file extensions used for graphic files supported in the class. The '.' character is omitted from file extension(s), and extensions are separated by a SemiColon ( ;) character.
In TBitmap, the method returns the value 'bmp' for the Windows Bitmap format supported in the class.

element.name: TBitmap.GetFileExtensions.Result
element.short: File extensions used for the image type.

element.name: TBitmap.GetResourceType
element.short: Gets the resource type identifier for the image format.

descr.p: GetResourceType is an overridden method used to get the resource type identifier for the image format. GetResourceType returns the value in the RT_BITMAP constant for the Windows Bitmap image format.

element.name: TBitmap.GetResourceType.Result
element.short: Returns the RT_BITMAP constant.

element.name: TBitmap.LoadFromStream
element.short: Loads image data from the specified stream.

descr.p: LoadFromStream is an overridden method used to read data for the image from the TStream instance specified in AStream. ASize contains the number of bytes to read in the method.

LoadFromStream provides supported for reading the image data from a resource stream. When AStream is a TResourceStream instance, an image header included in the stream is handled. This includes allocating additional storage for the header, and setting the type and size of the image header using the correct endian handling for bytes as needed for the platform.
LoadFromStream calls the inherited method to read the image data (including the header for a resource stream).

element.name: TBitmap.LoadFromStream.AStream
element.short: Stream instance with the image data loaded in the method.

element.name: TBitmap.LoadFromStream.ASize
element.short: Number of bytes to read in the method.

element.name: TSharedPixmap
element.short: Implements a reference-counted shared Pixmap image type.

element.name: TPixmap
element.short: Implements support for the XPM (Pixmap) image format.

descr.p: TPixMap is a TFPImageBitmap descendant, and is a wrapper used to handle the Pixmap ( 'XPM') image format.

Pixmap is an image file format used by the X Window System. It is intended primarily for creating icons, and supports transparent pixels. Derived from the earlier XBM syntax, it is a plain text file using the XPM2 format or a C programming language syntax, which can be included in a source code file.
TPixmap ensures that specified resources (image, file, or stream) are of the correct type and format.

element.name: TPixMap.GetReaderClass
element.short: Gets the class reference for a reader used during component streaming.

element.name: TPixMap.GetReaderClass.Result
element.short: Class reference for a reader used during component streaming.

element.name: TPixMap.GetWriterClass
element.short: Gets the class reference for a writer used during component streaming.

element.name: TPixMap.GetWriterClass.Result
element.short: Class reference for a writer used during component streaming.

element.name: TPixMap.GetSharedImageClass
element.short: Gets the class reference used to create the shared image in the class instance.

element.name: TPixMap.GetSharedImageClass.Result
element.short: class reference used to create the shared image in the class instance.

element.name: TPixmap.LazarusResourceTypeValid
element.short: Determines if the specified resource type is valid for the image format.

element.name: TPixmap.LazarusResourceTypeValid.Result
element.short: Returns True if the resource type is 'XPM'

element.name: TPixmap.LazarusResourceTypeValid.ResourceType
element.short: Resource type examined in the method.

element.name: TPixmap.GetFileExtensions
element.short: Gets the file extensions supported for the image type.

descr.p: GetFileExtensions is an overridden String class function used to get a delimited list of file extensions used for graphic files supported in the class. The '.' character is omitted from file extension(s), and extensions are separated by a SemiColon ( ;) character.
In TPixmap, the method returns the value 'xpm' for the Pixmap format supported in the class.

element.name: TPixmap.GetFileExtensions.Result
element.short: File extension(s) supported for the image format.

element.name: TSharedPortableNetworkGraphic
element.short: TSharedPortableNetworkGraphic - a reference counted PNG Image.

descr.p: TSharedPortableNetworkGraphic is a TSharedCustomBitmap descendant which implements a reference counted PNG image. TSharedPortableNetworkGraphic is the type returned by the GetSharedImageClass method in TPortableNetworkGraphic.

element.name: TPortableNetworkGraphic
element.short: Implements support for the PNG image format.

descr.p: TPortableNetworkGraphic is a TFPImageBitmap descendant which implements support for the PNG ( Portable Network Graphics) image format. PNG is a raster graphic file format that supports loss-less data compression. PNG was developed as an improved, non-patented replacement for GIF (Graphics Interchange Format).

PNG supports palette-based images (using 24-bit RGB or 32-bit RGBA colors), grayscale images (with or without alpha channel transparency), and full-color non-palette-based RGB or RGBA images. A PNG file contains a single image in an extensible chunk structure, and uses encoding to compress repetitive pixel values in the image.
PNG image files use the file extension PNG or png, and uses the MIME media type 'image/png'.

element.name: TPortableNetworkGraphic.IsStreamFormatSupported
element.short: Determines if the specified stream contains image data supported for the image type.

element.name: TSharedPortableAnyMapGraphic
element.short: TSharedPortableAnyMapGraphic - a reference counted shared PNM.

element.name: TPortableAnyMapGraphic
element.short: Implements an image which supports for the Portable Any Map (PNM) graphic format.
element.descr:
TPortableAnyMapGraphic is a TFPImageBitmap descendant which implements support for the Portable Any Map (PNM) graphic format.
PNM is a member of the NetPBM family of image formats and includes PBM, PGM, and PPM image formats. The group is referred to collectively as the Portable Any Map format, and uses the .PNM file extension.

element.name: TPortableAnyMapGraphic.IsStreamFormatSupported
element.short: Determines if the specified stream contains image data supported for the image type.

element.name: TIconImageClass
element.short: Class reference used to create new instances of TIconImage.

element.name: TSharedIcon
element.short: Implements a reference-counted shared Icon image type.

descr.p: TSharedIcon is a TSharedRasterImage descendant which implements a reference counted shared Icon. TSharedIcon provides access to the list of images available in the Icon as TIconImage instances using the Images property. Methods are provided to add, delete, clear, sort, and retrieve the images.
TSharedIcon is the type used to implement the internal shared image in TCustomIcon (and descendant classes).

element.name: TSharedIcon.FreeHandle
element.short: Frees the handle for the shared reference-counted icon.

descr.p: FreeHandle is an overridden method in TSharedIcon. It calls DestroyIcon to free the Handle for the shared Icon in the widgetset class. It does not call the inherited method. No actions are performed in the method when Handle contains 0 ( zero).

element.name: TSharedIcon.UpdateFromHandle
element.short: Frees the existing icon image and reloads it from the specified handle.

descr.p: Calls FreeHandle to free the existing handle for the Icon in the widgetset class, and sets the Handle to the value specified in NewHandle. Gets icon information from the widgetset class and adds a new icon image to the list of Images.

element.name: TSharedIcon.IsEmpty
element.short: Indicates if the shared icon is empty (contains no icon images).

element.name: TSharedIcon.GetImage
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Images property.

element.name: TSharedIcon.GetImage.Result
element.short: TIconImage instance at the specified position in the image list.

element.name: TSharedIcon.GetImage.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the image retrieved from the image list.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TSharedIcon: performs inherited Create then creates a list of images.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TSharedIcon: frees the list of images and performs inherited Destroy.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Clear
element.short: Clear - remove the icon and free its resources.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Delete
element.short: Removes the icon image with the specified index.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Delete.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the icon image removed in the method.

element.name: TSharedIcon.GetIndex
element.short: Gets the Index of an image with specified pixel format, height and width.

element.name: TSharedIcon.GetIndex.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the icon image matching the requested value(s).

element.name: TSharedIcon.GetIndex.AFormat
element.short: Pixel format (color depth) to locate in the Images.

element.name: TSharedIcon.GetIndex.AHeight
element.short: Height for the requested image.

element.name: TSharedIcon.GetIndex.AWidth
element.short: Width for the requested image.

element.name: TSharedIcon.GetImagesClass
element.short: Gets the class reference used to create a new icon image in the Images property.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Add
element.short: Adds the specified image to the list of Images in the icon.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Sort
element.short: Sorts values in Images using the IconCompare routine.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Count
element.short: Count - returns the number of references to the shared icon.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Images
element.short: Provides indexed access to the images available in the Icon.

element.name: TSharedIcon.Images.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for an icon image in the list of images.

element.name: TIconImage
element.short: TIconImage - a primitive Icon class with handles for the Bitmap, Mask and Palette.

element.name: TIconImage.GetPalette
element.short: Gets the value for the Palette property.

element.name: TIconImage.GetPalette.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TIconImage.RawImageNeeded
element.short: RawImageNeeded - if ADescOnly is True (descriptor only), then we need a Raw Image.

element.name: TIconImage.UpdateFromImage
element.short: Updates the icon image from the specified raw image data.

descr.p: UpdateFromImage is a procedure used to update the icon image from the specified raw image data.

AImage is a TRawImage instance with the image content stored in the RawImage property in the class instance. The image descriptor in AImage is examined to get the values stored in the Height and Width properties. The color depth in AImage is converted and stored in the PixelFormat property.
UpdateFromImage is called from the Create constructor when a TRawImage or a TIconInfo argument is provided.

element.name: TIconImage.UpdateFromImage.AImage
element.short: Raw image data stored in the method.

element.name: TIconImage.Create
element.short: Create - Specifies a Raw image to be used, then used Inherited Create.

descr.p: Create is the overloaded constructor for the class instance. Variants are provided with parameters which specify the dimensions and/or content for the icon image. The variant with the TIconInfo argument is used to create a new icon image when a handle is assigned in TSharedIcon.

element.name: TIconImage.Create.AFormat
element.short: Pixel format (color depth) for the image data.

element.name: TIconImage.Create.AHeight
element.short: Height in pixels for the image.

element.name: TIconImage.Create.AWidth
element.short: Width in pixels for the image.

element.name: TIconImage.Create.AImage
element.short: Raw image data used to load the content in the image.

element.name: TIconImage.Create.AInfo
element.short: Structure with Hotspot, Mask and Color information for the icon image.

element.name: TIconImage.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy ensures that existing values in Handle, MaskHandle, and Palette are freed by calling DeleteObject. The raw image data used the class instance is also freed. Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TIconImage.ReleaseHandle
element.short: Releases the Handle for the icon image.

descr.p: ReleaseHandle is a HBITMAP function used to release the Handle assigned for the icon image. The return value contains the HBITMAP value for Handle before it is released. ReleaseHandle sets the value in Handle to 0 ( zero) to indicate that the handle is no longer in use or invalid.
ReleaseHandle is called when a TCustomIcon descendant calls its InternalReleaseBitmapHandle method.
Use ReleaseMaskHandle to release the MaskHandle for the icon image.
Use ReleasePalette to release the Palette handle used in the icon image.

element.name: TIconImage.ReleaseMaskHandle
element.short: ReleaseMaskHandle - returns mask Bitmap handle to operating system.

element.name: TIconImage.ReleasePalette
element.short: ReleasePalette - returns Palette handle to operating system.

element.name: TIconImage.UpdateHandles
element.short: UpdateHandles - returns True when Bitmap and Mask handles have been updated.

descr.p: UpdateHandles is a Boolean function used to set the handles for the Bitmap and its optional Mask to the specified values. DeleteObject is called to remove existing handle value(s) in the Handle and MaskHandle properties.
The return value is True when the value(s) in Handle and/or MaskHandle are successfully set to the specified values.
UpdateHandles emulates the method with the same name in TCustomBitmap. UpdateHandles is called when the TIcon instance where the icon image is used calls its UpdateHandles method.

element.name: TIconImage.UpdateHandles.Result
element.short: True when the handles are successfully updated.

element.name: TIconImage.UpdateHandles.ABitmap
element.short: Handle for the Bitmap stored in the method.

element.name: TIconImage.UpdateHandles.AMask
element.short: Handle for the Mask stored in the method.

element.name: TIconImage.Height
element.short: The Height of the Icon.

element.name: TIconImage.Width
element.short: The Width of the Icon.

element.name: TIconImage.PixelFormat
element.short: PixelFormat - the format of the Pixels in the Image.

element.name: TIconImage.Handle
element.short: Handle - for the Bitmap.

element.name: TIconImage.MaskHandle
element.short: MaskHandle - Bitmap handle for the Mask.

element.name: TIconImage.Palette
element.short: Handle for the Palette.

descr.p: Palette is a read-only HPALETTE property which provides access to the color palette used in the Icon image.
descr.remark: Palette is not implemented in the current LCL version.

element.name: TIconImage.RawImage
element.short: Raw image data for the icon image.

descr.p: RawImage is a read-only TRawImage property which contains the raw image data for the icon image.
The property value is assigned in the Create method when a TRawImage argument is provided. The UpdateFromImage method is used to examine the raw image data and get the values stored in properties.

element.name: TCustomIcon
element.short: TCustomIcon - base class for TIcon.

descr.p: TCustomIcon is a TRasterImage descendant which implements the base class for TIcon. TIcon supports image files using the .ICO file format. An .ICO file typically contains several images with different sizes and/or color depths.

TCustomIcon extends the ancestor class to include an internal list of images, and provides overridden methods which use the list of images in their implementations. This includes the ReadData method used during LCL component streaming. ReadStream is overridden to handle not only multiple images but PNG and DIB image formats used in some Icon files.

When loading an icon file, the largest/most colorful image is selected as the current image. Other sizes and/or color depths are accessed by setting the value in the Current property, or using Size when Current is not already set, or by setting Current to the value from the GetBestIndexForSize method.
Use the Count, Add, Delete, Remove, Clear, and AssignImage methods to maintain the images in the internal list.
descr.remark: Please note that writing to an icon file is not currently implemented in TCustomIcon (or descendent classes).

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetCount
element.short: Gets the value for the Count property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetCount.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetCurrent
element.short: Sets the value for the Current property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetCurrent.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.FCurrent
element.short: FCurrent - local variable to hold current sequence number.

element.name: TCustomIcon.FRequestedSize
element.short: Member used for the requested icon size.

element.name: TCustomIcon.MaskHandleNeeded
element.short: Ensures that a handle for the mask in the icon is valid.

element.name: TCustomIcon.PaletteNeeded
element.short: An empty implementation in TCustomIcon.

descr.p: Palette information is handled in the .ICO image format.

element.name: TCustomIcon.CanShareImage
element.short: Indicates whether the image class type has a shared handle.

descr.p: Determines whether the the image class type can be shared. Returns True when AClass is derived from TSharedIcon.
This is a temporary work-around to make Assign work with cursors, icons and icnsicons.

element.name: TCustomIcon.CanShareImage.Result
element.short: Returns True when AClass is derived from TSharedIcon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.CheckRequestedSize
element.short: CheckRequestedSize - method to ensure correct size requested.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetIndex
element.short: GetIndex - returns the Index value of the Icon with specified format and size (.icn files can contain several versions of image).

descr.p: Gets the ordinal position in the internal image list for the icon with the specified pixel format, height, and width. The return value is -1 if an image using all of the requested values was not found in the list.
Assign the return value to the Current property to use it as the selected image for the icon.
Use GetBestIndexForSize to find the position of the image which matches most closely the specified height and width.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetIndex.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the image with the requested attributes, or -1 when not found.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetIndex.AFormat
element.short: Color depth for the requested icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetIndex.AHeight
element.short: Height for the requested icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetIndex.AWidth
element.short: Width for the requested icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetBitmapHandle
element.short: Gets the value for the BitmapHandle property.

descr.p: Implements the abstract method defined in the ancestor class.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetBitmapHandle.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetDefaultSize
element.short: GetDefaultSize - returns default size for Icon.

descr.p: GetDefaultSize is a TSize class function used to get the default size in new instances of the class. The return value uses the SM_CXICON and SM_CYICON values returned from the GetSystemMetrics function in its cx and cy members.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetDefaultSize.Result
element.short: TSize instance with the default width and height for an icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetMaskHandle
element.short: Gets the value for the MaskHandle property.

descr.p: GetMaskHandle implements the abstract method defined in the ancestor class.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetMaskHandle.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetPalette
element.short: Gets the value for the Palette property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetPalette.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetPixelFormat
element.short: Gets the value for the PixelFormat property.

descr.p: Implements the abstract virtual method defined in the ancestor class.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetPixelFormat.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetRawImagePtr
element.short: Gets a pointer to the raw image data for the icon.

descr.p: GetRawImagePtr is an overridden method used to get a pointer to the raw image data for the icon image. The return value is a PRawImage type which points to the data in a TIconImage instance in the shared image list for the icon.

GetRawImagePtr uses the value in Current to determine which image is retrieved from the internal image list. When Current is -1, the return value is Nil. Otherwise, the shared icon image at the position in Current is accessed to get the return value for the method.
GetRawImagePtr is called from AssignImage a raw image is assigned to the icon. It is also used to get mask image data in the MaskHandleNeeded method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetRawImagePtr.Result
element.short: Pointer to the raw image data, or Nil when Current is not assigned.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetStreamSignature
element.short: Gets the stream signature used for icon data.

descr.p: GetStreamSignature is a Cardinal class function used to get the signature which identifies the image content when stored in a stream. GetStreamSignature is used in the implementation of the ReadData method which reads the values for the class instance during LCL component streaming.
GetStreamSignature is defined as a virtual method, and is overridden in TIcon to use the value required for the icon image format.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetStreamSignature.Result
element.short: Cardinal value with the stream signature for the class.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetTypeID
element.short: Gets the icon type identifier used in the image list header.

descr.p: GetTypeId is a Word class function used to get the image type identifier used for icon images. It is used in the implementation of the WriteStream method, and provides the value stored in the icon image header.
Since TCustomIcon instances are not included in component streaming, the return value is always returns 0. GetTypeId is overridden in TIcon to provide the value used in the derived class.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetTypeID.Result
element.short: Type identifier for images in the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.HandleNeeded
element.short: Ensures that a handle for the image has been allocated.

descr.p: HandleNeeded is an overridden procedure used to ensure that a handle for the image has been allocated. HandleNeeded re-implements the method defined in the ancestor class.
No actions are performed in the method when a valid valid has already been assigned to the shared image in the class instance.
HandleNeeded calls the CreateIconIndirect routine for the widgetset to get the value used as the Handle for the shared image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.ReadData
element.short: Reads data for the class instance from a stream.

descr.p:
ReadData is an overridden method used to read the data for the class instance from the TStream instance specified in
Stream. ReadData is the method called when TFiler reads a persistent object during LCL component streaming.
ReadData saves the position in Stream on entry, and restores the original position prior to exiting from the method.

ReadData checks the values in Stream to determine if a size prefix for the content is stored in the stream. Delphi streaming does not include the size prefix. Current Lazarus versions do. When the LongInt value used as the StreamSignature is 0, the LoadFromStream method is called to load the contents of the stream. Otherwise, the inherited method is called to complete the operation.
ReadData is also called from the LoadFromResourceHandle method in TIcon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.ReadStream
element.short: Reads the content for the icon from the specified stream.

descr.p: ReadStream is an overridden procedure used to read the content for the icon from the stream specified in AStream. ReadStream implements the abstract virtual method defined in the ancestor class.
ReadStream verifies that AStream contains an icon image by checking for header value(s) that are valid for .ICO data. If the header values are nopt found, an EInvalidGraphic exception is raised.

For icon data, the icon directory must be read from the stream. The header contains the number of icon directory entries included in the stream. The icon directory entries are read from AStream, and include values for each icon image that includes:

ReadStream positions the stream, and reads image data for the each of the icon directory entries. It handles both DIB Bitmap and PNG (used in WIndows Vista) image data for the icon images. An FCL-compatible image reader is created as required for the image type, and a TLazIntfImage instance is used to capture the raw image data from the stream. Images read from the stream are added to the internal list of images in the TSharedIcon member for the class instance.
ReadStream calls CheckRequestedSize to use the Width and/or Height specified in the class instance. GetBestIndexForSize is called to determine the value in Current with the requested image size.

element.name: TCustomIcon.ReadStream.AStream
element.short: Stream instance with the image content read in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.ReadStream.ASize
element.short: Number of bytes expected for the icon data.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetMasked
element.short: Sets the value for the Masked property.

descr.p: SetMasked is an empty implementation in TCustomIcon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetMasked.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetPixelFormat
element.short: Sets the value for the PixelFormat property.

descr.p: Changing the value for PixelFormat raises an EInvalidGraphicOperation exception in TCustomIcon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetPixelFormat.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetTransparent
element.short: Sets the value for the Transparent property.

descr.p: SetTransparent is an empty implementation in TCustomIcon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetTransparent.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.UnshareImage
element.short: Unshares the shared image when the content in the icon is changed.

descr.p: UnshareImage is an overridden procedure used to stop sharing the image(s) for the icon. UnshareImage implements the abstract virtual method defined in the enacestor class.
No actions are performed in the method when the RefCount for the internal TSharedIcon instance is less than 1.
When sharing is stopped, the internal TSharedIcon instance in the class is re-created.

CopyContent indicates whether existing content from icon images is copied into the new image list. When set to True, TIconImage instances are re-created for each of the icon images and their existing content is copied. When set to False, image data for the icon is empty.
UnshareImage calls FreeCanvasContext to discard the device context used in the Canvas.
UnshareImage calls the Release method for the old TSharedIcon instance.
UnshareImage is called from methods which alter the handle or image content for the icon, including:

element.name: TCustomIcon.UnshareImage.CopyContent
element.short: True if existing image content is copied in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.UpdateCurrentView
element.short: UpdateCurrentView - updates the current appearance of the Icon.

descr.p: UpdateCurrentView is a procedure used to refresh the canvas when an icon image has been modified. UpdateCurrentView frees the device context (or handle) for the Canvas, and calls the Changed method.
UpdateCurrentView is called from methods like Add and Delete, and when a new icon image is selected by setting the value in the Current property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetHandle
element.short: Unshares an existing shared image handle and set the new value.

descr.p: SetHandle is a method used to set set the value for the shared image handle in the icon instance. It ensures that an existing shared image handle frees both its canvas context and the data in its TSharedImage instance.

It calls UpdateHandle to set the new shared handle for the icon instance to AValue. Values in Current and Count are reset when the handle is changed. Current is set 0 when multiple images are used in the icon. It is set to -1 when a single image is present. Changed is called to update the value in Modified and signal the OnCHange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetHandle.AValue
element.short: New value for the shared image handle in the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.UpdateHandle
element.short: Updates the handle in the shared icon image top the specified value.

descr.p: UpdateHandle is a Boolean function used to update the shared icon image when the handle specified in AValue differs from the handle in the shared image.
The return value is True when the handles have different values on entry. UpdateHandle calls the UpdateFromHandle method in the TSharedIcon instance using AValue as an argument.
No actions are performed in the method when the return value is False.
UpdateHandle is called when a new value is assigned to the Handle property.

element.name: TCustomIcon.UpdateHandle.Result
element.short: True when the handle in the icon is different that the handle in the shared icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.UpdateHandle.AValue
element.short: Handle compared to the shared icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.UpdateHandles
element.short: Sets the Bitmap and Mask handles for the current image in the icon.

descr.p: UpdateHandles is an overridden method used to set the Bitmap and Mask handles for the Current icon image to the specified values. UpdateHandles implements the abstract virtual method defined in the ancestor class.
UpdateHandles uses the value in Current to determine the TIconImage in the internal image list that is updated in the method.
When Current is set to -1, an icon image has not been selected and no actions are performed in the method. The return value is False if the handles could not be applied to icon image.

UpdateHandles calls the UpdateHandles method for the TIconImage indicated in Current using the values in ABitmap and AMask as arguments. The return value is True if the handles are successfully applied to the icon image.
UpdateHandles is called from methods like:

element.name: TCustomIcon.UpdateHandles.Result
element.short: True if the new handles are successfully applied to the icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.UpdateHandles.ABitmap
element.short: Bitmap handle for the current image in the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.UpdateHandles.AMask
element.short: Mask handle for the current image in the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.WriteStream
element.short: Writes the content for the multi-image icon to the specified stream.

descr.p: WriteStream is an overridden method used to write the content for the multi-image icon to the stream specified in AStream. WriteStream implements the abstract virtual method defined in the ancestor class.

WriteStream performs actions needed to write the header, icon directory, and content for each of the images used in the multi-image icon to the TMemoryStream instance. It handles both PNG and DIB Bitmap icon images, and creates Mask data for images when it is not already present.
For icon images used in TCursorImage, the X and Y coordinates for the HotSpot are also included in the image data.
WriteStream is called from SaveStreamNeeded when the SaveToStream method is performed.

element.name: TCustomIcon.WriteStream.AStream
element.short: TMemoryStream instance where icon data is stored.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor on entry. Create sets the default values for properties, including:

dl.dd: Set to -1 to indicate that an icon image has not been selected.
Set to True. By definition, an icon is masked. Does not account for icon images with an alpha channel.

descr.p: Create initializes the internal member used to track the size for a requested icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Add
element.short: Add - an Icon formatted as AFormat, with specified Height and Width.

descr.p: Add is procedure used to create an image for the icon with the attributes specified in AFormat, AHeight, and AWidth. Add calls GetIIndex to determine if an icon image with the requested attributes already exists in the image list for the icon. An EInvalidGraphicOperation exception is raised when the image already exists in the internal image list.

Add calls UnshareImage to release the shared image handle, and adds a new image class instance to the shared icon. If the icon image is the first one in the list, the value in Current is set to 0 (zero) and the UpdateCurrentView method is called.
Use Current to make an icon image active for the class instance. Use AssignImage to store the image at the position in Current.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Add.AFormat
element.short: Pixel format (color depth) for the icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Add.AHeight
element.short: Height in pixels for the icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Add.AWidth
element.short: Width in pixels for the icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Assign
element.short: Copies values from the specified persistent object into the current class instance.

descr.p: Assign is an overridden method used to copyvalues from the persistent object in Source into the current class instance. Assign calls BeginUpdate to increment the active update counter, and calls EndUpdate prior to exiting from the method.
Assign handles specific class types in Source, including:

dl.dd: Calls Clear to remove existing image content, and calls Add to create and icon image with the attributes in the PixelFormat, Height, and Width properties in Source. Calls AssignImage to store the image content from Source in the icon image. If the shared image class in Source is different than the one for the current class instance, UnshareImage is called.
Sets the value in Current to the value found in Source.

descr.p: When Source is derived from another class type, the inherited Assign method is called.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Assign.Source
element.short: Persistent object with values copied into the current class instance.

element.name: TCustomIcon.AssignImage
element.short: Copies image data from the source image to the current icon image.

descr.p: AssignImage is used to copy image data from ASource to the currently selected image for the icon.

AssignImage is typically used to assign the icon image when Add is used to create a new icon image with the required attributes (PixelFormat, Height, Width). AssignImage is called from the Assign method to store a single raster image to the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.AssignImage.ASource
element.short: Image with the values assigned to the current icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Clear
element.short: Removes the image content for the icon.

descr.p: Clear is an overridden method used to remove the image content for the icon. Clear frees the internal save stream for the image. The internal shared image is also freed and re-created. The value in Current is set to -1 to indicate that an icon image has not been selected.
Clear calls the Changed method to set the value in Modified and signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).
No actions are performed in the method when Empty returns True.
descr.remark: Clear does not call the method inherited from TRasterImage.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Delete
element.short: Deletes the image at the specified position in the list of images for the icon.

descr.p: Delete is a procedure used to delete the icon image at the ordinal position specified in AIndex from the list of images for the icon.
Delete calls UnshareImage to stop sharing the image list for the icon. A copy of the images is kept and restored when the Delete method in TSharedIcon has removed the image at the specified postion.
When AIndex is also the Current image for the icon, Current is set to -1 and the UpdateCurrentView method is called. Otherwise, the value in Current is decremented.
Use Remove to delete an icon image with specific PixelFormat, Height, and Width values.
Use Add to add an icon image with specific PixelFormat, Height, and Width values.
Use Count to determine the number of images in the list of images for the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Delete.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the icon image deleted in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Remove
element.short: Removes an icon image with the specified attributes.

descr.p: Remove is used to locate and delete an icon image with the attributes specified in AFormat, AHeight, and AWidth.

Remove calls GetIndex to get the position in the internal image list where the icon image with the specified attributes is stored. If an image is found, the Delete method is called to the remove the icon image.
The value in Current is modified when it represents an icon image affected by the removal. Current is set to -1 when it contains the index for the icon image removed in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Remove.AFormat
element.short: Pixel format (color depth) for the icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Remove.AHeight
element.short: Height for the icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Remove.AWidth
element.short: Width for the icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetDescription
element.short: Gets metadata which describes the icon image at the specified position in the image list.

descr.p: GetDescription is used to get image metadata whcih describes the icon image at the position specified in AIndex. AFormat, AHeight, and AWidth are output parameters where the corresponding values from the TIconImage instance are stored.
GetDescription accesses the image list in the internal TSharedIcon instance used in the class.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetDescription.AIndex
element.short: Aindex - the Index value for the Icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetDescription.AFormat
element.short: AFormat - the Pixel Format for the Icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetDescription.AHeight
element.short: AHeight - the height of the Icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetDescription.AWidth
element.short: AWidth - the width of the Icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetSize
element.short: Sets the size (width, height) for the image in the Icon.

descr.p: SetSize is an overridden method used to set the size for the image in the icon to the values specified in AWidth and AHeight. SetSize implements the abstract virtual method defined in the ancestor class. SetSize stores the argument values in an internal member used to track the requested icon image size used in the GetBestIndexForSize method.
SetSize raises an EInvalidGraphicOperation exception when an icon size has been selected by setting a value in the Current property.
SetSize is called from the ReadStream method.

element.errors: Raises an EInvalidGraphicOperation with the message in rsIconImageSizeChange when Current contains a value other than -1.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetSize.AWidth
element.short: New Width for the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetSize.AHeight
element.short: New Height for the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetFileExtensions
element.short: Gets a delimited list of file extensions supported for the image type.

descr.p: GetFileExtensions is an overridden String class function used to get a delimited list of file extensions supported for the image type. In TCustomIcon and TIcon, the return value is always 'ico'.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetFileExtensions.Result
element.short: Delimited list of file extensions supported for the image type.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LazarusResourceTypeValid
element.short: Determines if the specified resource type is valid for the image format.

descr.p: LazarusResourceTypeValid is an overridden Boolean function used to determine if the specified resource type is valid for the image format.

The return value is True when ResourceType contains 'ICO' or 'ICON'. The inherited method is called to get the return value when ResourceType contains any other resource type name. Case is not significant when comparing the value in ResourceType; it is converted to uppercase in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LazarusResourceTypeValid.Result
element.short: True when the resource type identifier is valid for the image format.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LazarusResourceTypeValid.ResourceType
element.short: Resource type identifier examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LoadFromResourceName
element.short: Loads the icon with the specified resource name from the instance handle.

descr.p: LoadFromResourceName is an overridden procedure used to load a resource with the name specified in ResName using the handle provided in Instance. LoadFromResourceName re-implements the method defined in the ancestor class, and does not call the inherited method.

LoadFromResourceName calls GetResourceType to get the Integer resource type used in the class instance. No actions are performed in the method when the TResourceType value is unassigned (contains Nil).

LoadFromResourceName calls FindResource to get the resource handle needed in the method. An EResNotFound exception is raised if a resource with the specified name and type is not found in FindResource.
LoadFromResourceName calls LoadFromResourceHandle to load the icon using the Instance and resource handle values.
Use LoadFromResourceID to load a resource by its Resource ID.
Use LoadFromLazarusResource to load a Lazarus resource from a .lrs file with a give name.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LoadFromResourceName.Instance
element.short: Handle where the content for the resource is stored.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LoadFromResourceName.ResName
element.short: Name for the resource loaded in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LoadFromResourceID
element.short: Load icon data from a resource with the specified integer resource identifier.

descr.p: LoadFromResourceID is an overridden procedure used to load a resource with the specified Resource ID into the class instance. LoadFromResourceID re-implements the method defined in the ancestor class, and does not call the inherited method.
Instance contains the Handle used to read the resource. ResID contains an Integer pointer to the resource identifier loaded in the method.
LoadFromResourceID calls GetResourceType to get the Integer resource type used in the class instance. No actions are performed in the method when the TResourceType value is unassigned (contains Nil).
LoadFromResourceName calls FindResource to get the resource handle needed in the method. An EResNotFound exception is raised if a resource with the specified ID and type is not found in FindResource.
LoadFromResourceName calls LoadFromResourceHandle to load the icon using the Instance and resource handle values.
Use LoadFromResourceName to load a resource with a given resource name.
Use LoadFromLazarusResource to load a Lazarus resource from a .lrs file with a give name.

element.errors: Raises an EResNotFound exception if the resource handle for the specified ID and type is not valid.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LoadFromResourceID.Instance
element.short: Handle where the content for the resource is stored.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LoadFromResourceID.ResID
element.short: Integer resource identifier loaded in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LoadFromResourceHandle
element.short: Loads icon data from the specified instance and resource handles.

descr.p: LoadFromResourceHandle has an empty implementation in TCustomIcon. It is re-implemented in TIcon descendant.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LoadFromResourceHandle.Instance
element.short: Handle with the resource data loaded in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.LoadFromResourceHandle.ResHandle
element.short: Resource handle with the icon data loaded in the method.

element.name: TCustomIcon.BitmapHandleAllocated
element.short: Indicates if a handle for the icon image has been allocated.

descr.p: BitmapHandleAllocated is an overridden Boolean function which indicates if a handle for the icon image has been allocated in the class instance. BitmapHandleAllocated implements the abstract virtual method defined in the ancestor class.
The return value is True when Current has a valid image index for the icon image, and the handle for the TIconImage in the shared icon has a non-zero value.
BitmapHandleAllocated is called from methods that required a valid image handle prior to performing actions using the image data. For example:

element.name: TCustomIcon.BitmapHandleAllocated.Result
element.short: True when a valid handle has been assigned for the shared icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.MaskHandleAllocated
element.short: True if a handle has been allocated for the mask in the image.

descr.p: MaskHandleAllocated is an overridden method used to determine if a handle for the image mask has been allocated in the class instance. MaskHandleAllocated implements the abstract virtual method defined in the ancestor class.
The return value is True when Current contains a value other than -1, and the MaskHandle for the TIconImage in the shared image list has a non-zero value.
MaskHandleAllocated is called from methods that required a valid handle prior to performing actions using the mask image data. For example:

element.name: TCustomIcon.MaskHandleAllocated.Result
element.short: True when the MaskHandle has been allocated for the icon image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.PaletteAllocated
element.short: Determine if a handle has been allocated for the Palette in the icon.

descr.p: PaletteAllocated is an overridden method used to determine if a handle has been allocated for the Palette in the icon image. PaletteAllocated implements the abstract virtual method defined in the ancestor class.
The return value is True when Current contains a value other than -1, and the palette handle in the TIconImage instance for the shared icon image has a non-zero value.
descr.remark: While provided as property in TCustomIcon, Palette is never assigned in the TIconImage class instances used to represent the individual images in the icon. Effectively, Palette is not implemented for TCustomIcon and PaletteAllocated will always return False.

element.name: TCustomIcon.PaletteAllocated.Result
element.short: True when the Palette handle has been allocated for the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetHandles
element.short: Not implemented in TCustomIcon.

descr.p: SetHandles has an empty implementation in TCustomIcon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetHandles.ABitmap
element.short: Handle for the Bitmap in the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.SetHandles.AMask
element.short: Handle for the Mask in the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Sort
element.short: Sorts the images for the icon.

descr.p: Sorts images in the internal image list for the icon. The Sort method in TSharedIcon is called to perform the sort, and compares the Width/PixelFormat values in the images to determine the sort order. Preference is given to the value in Width; if two items have the same Width, the value in PixelFormat is used for the comparison.

Sort keeps a reference to the image in Current when it is set to a value other than -1. The image is used to restore the value in Current when the sort operation is completed. The IndexOf method for the internal image list is called determine the new position for the referenced image.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetBestIndexForSize
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the image closest to the requested size.

descr.p: The default icon size from GetSystemMetrics is used when ASize does not have explicit values in its cx and cy members. The best color depth is determined using the GetDeviceCaps routine for the screen context.

GetBestIndexForSize iterates over the items in the internal image list to find the TIconImage which most closely matches the required values. The return value is -1 if no images are stored in the internal image list for the icon.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetBestIndexForSize.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the image, or -1 when no images are available.

element.name: TCustomIcon.GetBestIndexForSize.ASize
element.short: TSize instance with the height and width for the requested image size.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Current
element.short: Ordinal position for the current image displayed for the icon.

descr.p: Current is an Integer property which contains the ordinal position for the selected image in the icon. Setting a new value for the property causes the UpdateCurrentView method to be called to update the Canvas, and the save stream for the shared image. The OnChange event handler is signalled (when assigned).
Set Current to -1 before calling SetSize (or changing values in Height and Width) to avoid raising an EInvalidGraphicOperation exception.

element.name: TCustomIcon.Count
element.short: Number of images in the image list for the shared icon.

descr.p: Count is a read-only Integer property which contains the number of images in the internal image list for the icon. Read access for the property value is redirected to the Count property in the internal TSharedIcon instance used in the class.
Use methods like Add, Delete, Remove, Clear, Assign, and AssignImage to maintain the list of images available in the icon.

element.name: TIcon
element.short: Implements an icon image type; small images typically associated with applications, controls, etc.

descr.p: Icons can be loaded from .ICO files, or from Lazarus resources. An icon resource typically contains several versions of the same image, in multiple resolutions and color depths.
When loading, the largest/most colorful image is loaded as the Bitmap property, and so can be handled as any other bitmap.

element.errors: Writing to icon files is not (yet) implemented.

element.name: TIcon.GetIconHandle
element.short: Gets the value for the Handle property.

element.name: TIcon.GetIconHandle.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TIcon.SetIconHandle
element.short: Sets the value for the Handle property.

element.name: TIcon.SetIconHandle.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TIcon.HandleNeeded
element.short: Ensures that handle values for the icon are valid.

descr.p: Ensures that Handle values are valid for the icon. Configures the values in IconInfo with the BitmapHandle and MaskHandle for the class instance. Calls CreateIconIndirect for the widgetset to get the Handle used for the shared image in the icon.
No actions are performed in the method when the Handle for the shared icon image has already been assigned.

element.name: TIcon.LoadFromResourceHandle
element.short: Loads icon data from the specified instance and resource handles.

element.name: TIcon.LoadFromResourceHandle.Instance
element.short: Handle with the resource data loaded in the method.

element.name: TIcon.LoadFromResourceHandle.ResHandle
element.short: Resource handle with the icon data loaded in the method.

element.name: TIcon.ReleaseHandle
element.short: Frees the Handle used for the Icon.

element.name: TIcon.ReleaseHandle.Result
element.short: HICON value removed from the Handle in the class instance.

element.name: TIcon.GetResourceType
element.short: Gets the Integer Resource Type for the class instance.

descr.p: GetResourceType is an overridden TResourceType function in TIcon. It is used to get the resource type identifier for the class instance. It identifies the storage format used for graphic data in a resource.
The return value is RT_GROUP_ICON in TIcon.

element.name: TIcon.GetResourceType.Result
element.short: Resource type used for the icon image type.

element.name: TIcon.Handle
element.short: Handle used to access the image data for the icon.

descr.p: Handle is a HICON property which contains the icon handle used to access image data for the icon. The property value is provided by the GetHandle method.

element.name: TSharedCursorImage
element.short: Implements a reference-counted shared image used for cursors.

element.name: TSharedCursorImage.FreeHandle
element.short: Frees the handle for the cursor image.

element.name: TSharedCursorImage.GetImagesClass
element.short: Gets the class reference used to create a new cursor image in the Images property.

element.name: TSharedCursorImage.GetImagesClass.Result
element.short: Class reference used to create images in the shared cursor image list.

element.name: TCursorImageImage
element.short: Implements the image for a cursor, stored as an Icon.

descr.p: Provides a HotSpot property with the coordinates in the cursor that is the point that interacts with other elements on the screen.

element.name: TCursorImageImage.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Calls the inherited constructor on entry using the value in AInfo as an argument. AInfo contains the coordinates that are assigned to the HotSpot property.

element.name: TCursorImageImage.Create.AInfo
element.short: TIconInfo instance with the hotspot information for the cursor image.

element.name: TCursorImageImage.HotSpot
element.short: HotSpot - the coordinates of the point to which the cursor refers, and which represents the 'active' position on the current form or canvas.

element.name: TCursorImage
element.short: TCursorImage - an Icon to be used to represent a cursor.

element.name: TCursorImage.GetHotSpot
element.short: Gets the value for the HotSpot property.

element.name: TCursorImage.GetHotSpot.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCursorImage.GetCursorHandle
element.short: Gets the value for the CursorHandle property.

element.name: TCursorImage.GetCursorHandle.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCursorImage.SetCursorHandle
element.short: Sets the value for the CursorHandle property.

element.name: TCursorImage.SetCursorHandle.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCursorImage.GetResourceType
element.short: Gets the resource type identifier for the cursor image.

descr.p: Returns RT_GROUP_CURSOR in TCursorImage.

element.name: TCursorImage.ReleaseHandle
element.short: ReleaseHandle - free the handle used for the cursor Image.

element.name: TCursorImage.SetCenterHotSpot
element.short: Updates the HotSpot coordinate to the center point for the Current image in the cursor.

element.name: TCursorImage.HotSpot
element.short: HotSpot - the coordinates of the point to which the cursor refers, and which represents the 'active' position on the current form or canvas.

element.name: TCursorImage.Handle
element.short: Handle for the cursor image.

descr.p: Handle is a HCURSOR property in TCursorImage, and contains the handle used to identify the cursor image. The value for the property is provided by the GetHandle method.

Setting a new value for Handle causes the device context in Canvas to be freed, and the shared image for the icon is cleared. The UpdateHandle method is called to update the shared image using the new value for the property. If the shared icon contains image data, the value in Current is set to 0 (the first image in the internal list of images). Otherwise, Current is set to -1.
Changed is called to re-create the internal save stream for the shared image and signal the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TSharedJpegImage
element.short: TSharedJpegImage - a reference counted shared image of type JPEG.

element.name: TJPEGQualityRange
element.short: Represents JPEG compression quality values.

descr.p: TJPEGQualityRange is an alias to the TFPJPEGCompressionQuality type defined in the FCL. TJPEGQualityRange is the type used to implement the CompressionQuality property in TJPEGImage.

element.name: TJPEGPerformance
element.short: Represents JPEG read performance setting values.

descr.p: TJPEGPerformance is an alias to the TJPEGReadPerformance type defined in the FCL. TJPEGPerformance is the type used to implement the Performance property in TJpegImage.

element.name: TJPEGImage
element.short: TJPEGImage - a class for handling images stored in JPEG (compressed) format.

descr.p: TJPEGImage is a TFPImageBitmap descendant which implements support for the JPEG ( Joint Photographic Experts Group) image format. JPEG images are commonly used for storing digital photographs. They can represent detailed color photos using a high degree of compression, resulting in very efficient storage, though with some loss of quality.
JPEG image files normally have a file extension like: jpeg, jpg, jpe, or jfif.

The CompressionQuality and Performance properties can be used to set the balance between storage efficiency and picture quality. CompressionQuality is an Integer value between 1 and 100, with 100 representing the best quality. Performance is an enumerated variable with two states: BestQuality or BestSpeed (for compression).

element.name: TJPEGImage.SetCompressionQuality
element.short: Sets the value for the CompressionQuality property.

element.name: TJPEGImage.SetCompressionQuality.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TJPEGImage.SetGrayScale
element.short: Sets the value for the GrayScale property.

element.name: TJPEGImage.SetGrayScale.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TJPEGImage.SetProgressiveEncoding
element.short: Sets the value for the ProgressiveEncoding property.

element.name: TJPEGImage.SetProgressiveEncoding.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TJPEGImage.InitializeReader
element.short: Initializes the FCL-compatible image reader for the image type.

descr.p: InitializeReader is an overridden method used transfer property values specific to the JPEG image in AImage to the TFPCustomImageReader class instance in AReader. The following property values are stored to the corresponding properties in AReader:

element.name: TJPEGImage.InitializeReader.AImage
element.short: Image with values used to configure the reader class.

element.name: TJPEGImage.InitializeReader.AReader
element.short: FCL-compatible image reader class updated in the method.

element.name: TJPEGImage.InitializeWriter
element.short: Initializes the FCL-compatible Image Writer for the image type.

element.name: TJPEGImage.InitializeWriter.AImage
element.short: Image with values used to configure the writer class.

element.name: TJPEGImage.InitialWriter.AWriter
element.short: FCL-compatible image writer class updated in the method.

element.name: TJPEGImage.FinalizeReader
element.short: Finalizes the FCL Image reader.

element.name: TJPEGImage.FinalizeReader.AReader
element.short: FCL-compatible image reader examined in the method.

element.name: TJPEGImage.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the TJpegImage class instance, and calls the inherited constructor on entry. Creates sets the default values for properties, including:

dl.dd: Set to jpBestQuality.
Set to False.
Set to False.
Set to 75.

element.name: TJpegImage.Compress
element.short: Applies compression settings in the class instance to the image data.

element.name: TJPEGImage.IsStreamFormatSupported
element.short: Indicates if the stream contains a format supported for the image type.

element.name: TJPEGImage.IsStreamFormatSupported.Result
element.short: True when Stream contains a valid image format for the image type.

element.name: TJPEGImage.IsStreamFormatSupported.Stream
element.short: TStream instance examined in the method.

element.name: TJPEGImage.GetFileExtensions
element.short: Gets the file extension(s) supported for the image format.

element.name: TJPEGImage.GetFileExtensions.Result
element.short: Delimited list of file extensions supported for the image type.

element.name: TJPEGImage.CompressionQuality
element.short: Determine the compression quality for the image data.

descr.p: Extreme compression can lead to loss of quality at the expense of a small file size.
The allowed range is 1..100, where 100 is best quality, and 25 is pretty awful.

element.name: TJPEGImage.GrayScale
element.short: Indicates if the image contains grayscale image data.

element.name: TJpegImage.MinHeight
element.short: Minimum height allowed for the image when read using an FCL image reader.

element.name: TJpegImage.MinWidth
element.short: Minimum width allowed for the image when read using an FCL image reader.

element.name: TJPEGImage.ProgressiveEncoding
element.short: Indicates if progressive encoding is used for the image data.

element.name: TJPEGImage.Performance
element.short: Set for best quality or best speed.

element.name: TJpegImage.Scale
element.short: A predefined scaling value applied to the image data.

descr.p: Scale is a TJPEGScale property which contains one of the prefined scaling values applied to the raw image data. For instance:

dl.dd: Image is not scaled.
Image is scaled to one-half of its width and height.
Image is scaled to one-quarter of its width and height.
Image is scaled to one-eighth of its width and height.

element.name: TJpegImage.Smoothing
element.short: Indicates if smoothing is applied to the raw image data.

descr.p: Smoothing is a Boolean property which indicates if smoothing is applied to raw data in the image. Smoothing uses a low pass filter to remove high spatial frequency noise from a digital image.

The value in Smoothing is used in the InitializeReader method to configure the image reader used to load the raw image data. Set the value in Smoothing prior to calling methods which load the image content using an FCL-compatible image reader.

element.name: TTiffUnit.tuUnknown
element.short: Unit of measurement is unknown.

element.name: TTiffUnit.tuNone
element.short: No absolute unit of measurement.

descr.p: Used for images that may have a non-square aspect ratio, but no meaningful absolute dimensions.

element.name: TTiffUnit.tuInch
element.short: Unit of measure is Inches.

element.name: TTiffUnit.tuCentimeter
element.short: Unit of measure is Centimeters.

element.name: TTiffImage
element.short: Implements support for the TIFF (Tag Image File Format) graphic format.

descr.p: TTiffImage is a TFPImageBitmap descendant which implements support for the TIFF (Tag Image File Format) image format.

It is a raster graphics image format. TIFF is widely supported by scanning, faxing, word processing, optical character recognition, image manipulation, desktop publishing, and page-layout applications. TIFF was created for use as a common image format for scanners. Various revisions to the specification have added grayscale and color support to the image format. It is a popular format for deep-color images.
TIFF images use .TIF or .TIFF file extensions, and the MIME types 'image/TIF' or 'image/TIFF'.

TTiffImage implements the class methods from the ancestor class which get FCL TFPCustomImageReaderClass and TFPCustomImageWriterClass instances, as well as the shared graphics class instance for the image format.
TTiffImage has properties which expose values for Baseline Tags in the image data, including:

element.name: TTiffImage.FMake
element.short: Scanner manufacturer or brand.

element.name: TTiffImage.FModel
element.short: Scanner model.

element.name: TTiffImage.InitializeReader
element.short: Initializes the FCL-compatible image reader for the image.

element.name: TTiffImage.InitializeWriter
element.short: Initializes the FCL-compatible image writer for the image.

element.name: TTiffImage.FinalizeReader
element.short: Captures values from the image reader after loading an image.

element.name: TTiffImage.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor on entry. Create sets the default value for the Title property to include the class name, the LCL version, and the FPC version.

element.name: TTiffImage.GetFileExtensions
element.short: Get the delimited list of file extension(s) for files which support the image format.
element.descr: In TTiffImage, the return value is: 'tif;tiff'.

element.name: TTiffImage.Artist
element.short: Person who created the image.

element.name: TTiffImage.Copyright
element.short: Copyright notice for the image.

element.name: TTiffImage.DateTime
element.short: Date and time the image was created.

element.name: TTiffImage.HostComputer
element.short: The computer and/or operating system where the image was created.

element.name: TTiffImage.ImageDescription
element.short: A string that describes the subject of the image.

element.name: TTiffImage.Make
element.short: The scanner manufacturer.

element.name: TTiffImage.Model
element.short: The scanner model name or number.

element.name: TTiffImage.ResolutionUnit
element.short: The unit of measurement for XResolution and YResolution.

element.name: TTiffImage.Software
element.short: Name and version number for the software used to create the image.

element.name: TTiffImage.XResolution
element.short: Number of pixels in ResolutionUnits for the image width.

element.name: TTiffImage.YResolution
element.short: Number of pixels in ResolutionUnits for the image height.

element.name: TSharedGIFImage
element.short: Implements a reference-counted shared GIF image.

element.name: TGIFImage
element.short: Implements an image using the GIF (Graphics Interchange Format) image format.

descr.p: TGIFImage is a TFPImageBitmap descendant which implements support for the GIF ( Graphics Interchange Format) image format. GIF images support up to 8 bits per pixel in the image data, and a color palette of up to 256 colors from the 24-bit RGB color space. While GIF images allow animation, the LCL implementation does not support the feature.

element.name: TGIFImage.FinalizeReader
element.short: Updates the image when the reader has finished loading the image content.

descr.p: Ensures that image properties discovered using the reader class are applied to the properties in the GIF image.
Calls the inherited method on entry. Copies values found in AReader to the following properties:
FinalizeReader is called from the ReadStream method when the reader class has loaded the image content into a TLazIntfImage instance.

element.name: TGIFImage.FinalizeReader.AReader
element.short: FCL-compatible reader for the image type.

element.name: TGIFImage.GetSharedImageClass
element.short: Gets the class reference used to create the shared image in new class instances.

element.name: TGIFImage.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Calls the inherited constructor on entry.

element.name: TGIFImage.IsStreamFormatSupported
element.short: Determines if the specified Stream contains a valid GIF image format.

element.name: TGIFImage.IsStreamFormatSupported.Result
element.short: True when the stream contains the GIF87a or GIF89a signature.

element.name: TGIFImage.IsStreamFormatSupported.Stream
element.short: TStream instance with values examined in the method.

element.name: TGIFImage.GetFileExtensions
element.short: Gets the file extensions used for the GIF image format.

element.name: TGIFImage.GetFileExtensions.Result
element.short: Returns the value 'gif'

element.name: TGIFImage.Transparent
element.short: Indicates if the image is drawn with transparent pixels.

element.name: TGIFImage.Interlaced
element.short: Indicates if the image uses the "venetian blind" effect during display.

notes.note: TODO: Describe GIF89a. Two pass using alternating lines. Similar to progressive JPEG.

element.name: TGIFImage.BitsPerPixel
element.short: Number of bits needed to represent a pixel in the image.

descr.p: BitsPerPixel indicates the color depth (or maximum number of colors) that can be represented in the image data.

element.name: GraphicFilter
element.short: Gets a filter string for files using the specified image class type.

element.name: GraphicExtension
element.short: Gets a string with the file extension used for the specified image class type.

descr.p: Calls GetPicFileFormats to get the list which maps TGraphicClass (or descendent) references to a file extension.

GraphicExtension iterates over the values in the mapping list in reverese order, and compares the class name for the list item to the class name in GraphicClass. When a match is found, the GetFormatExt method for the item is called to get the return value for the function.
The return value is an empty string ('') when a mapping for GraphicClass is not found in the list.

element.name: GraphicExtension.Result
element.short: File extension for the image type.

element.name: GraphicExtension.GraphicClass
element.short: Graphic class used to determine the file extension.

element.name: GraphicFileMask
element.short: Gets a file filter which can be used to select image files for the specified TGraphicClass instance.

element.name: GraphicFileMask.Result
element.short: File filter for the graphics class, or an empty string when the graphics class is not supported.

element.name: GraphicFileMask.GraphicClass
element.short: TGraphicsClass instance to locate in the supported graphic formats.

element.name: GetGraphicClassForFileExtension
element.short: Gets the TGraphicClass instance used for images with the specified file extension.

element.name: GetGraphicClassForFileExtension.Result
element.short: TGraphicClass descendant for the image format.

element.name: GetGraphicClassForFileExtension.FileExt
element.short: File extension used to determine the TGraphicClass for an image format.

element.name: TGetColorStringProc
element.short: Specifies an object procedure used to process color value to color identifier map entries.

element.name: IdentEntry
element.short: Checks whether a given Entry exists in a Map of color names.

descr.p: IdentEntry checks whether a given Entry exists in a Map of color names.
A list of system Colors is specified as a look-up table of indices (Entry) and names (MapEntry).
This function checks that the value in Entry is within the permitted range, and returns the data pair Value, Name of the corresponding color in MapEntry.
If Entry is out of range the Result is False.

element.errors: If Entry is out of the range [0..High(colors)] the Result is returned as False.

element.name: IdentEntry.Result
element.short: True if Entry was a valid index into the color look-up table.

element.name: IdentEntry.Entry
element.short: Entry - a numeric index into the table of colors.

element.name: IdentEntry.MapEntry
element.short: MapEntry - the record of Value, Name returned from the look-up table of Colors.

element.name: ColorToIdent
element.short: ColorToIdent - given a Color value, find its name (Ident) in the look-up table of Colors.

element.name: ColorToIdent.Result
element.short: Returns True if there is a valid entry in the Colors look-up table.

element.name: ColorToIdent.Color
element.short: the Color value to be sought in the look-up table.

element.name: ColorToIdent.Ident
element.short:
Ident - the name of the supplied Color as found in the look-up table of
Colors.

element.name: IdentToColor
element.short: IdentToColor - given a color identifier (name) returns the color value.

element.name: IdentToColor.Result
element.short: Returns True if Ident is part of a valid entry in the look-up table of Colors.

element.name: IdentToColor.Ident
element.short: Ident - the supplied name for the required Color.

element.name: IdentToColor.Color
element.short: The Color returned from the look-up table, with the name supplied in Ident.

element.name: ColorIndex
element.short: Finds the position in the color identifier map for the specified value.

descr.p:
ColorIndex is a
Boolean function used to determine if the color value specified in
Color exists in the color value to name identifier map.

ColorIndex iterates over the values in the Colors constant to find an element in the array with the value specified in Color. The position for the value is assigned to the Index output parameter. The return value is True when a value is located in Colors. Otherwise, the return value is False. The value in Index is not significant when the return value is False.

element.name: ColorIndex.Result
element.short: True when the color value exists in Colors.

element.name: ColorIndex.Color
element.short: Color value to locate in Colors.

element.name: ColorIndex.Index
element.short: Position in Colors where the color value was found.

element.name: SysColorToSysColorIndex
element.short: SysColorToSysColorIndex - if Color is one of the system colors, returns the Index of the system color.
element.errors: If Color is not a system color, returns -1.

element.name: SysColorToSysColorIndex.Result
element.short: Returns the Index value of the Color if it is a system color, otherwise returns -1

element.name: SysColorToSysColorIndex.Color
element.short: The Color to examine in the routine.

element.name: ColorToRGB
element.short: Converts a TColor value to an RGB color constant.

descr.p: ColorToRGB ensures that TColor values for special and system colors remove the non-RGB values in the constant.

element.name: ColorToRGB.Result
element.short: LongInt value representing the specified color.

element.name: ColorToRGB.Color
element.short: TColor value converted in the method.

element.name: ColorToString
element.short: ColorToString - given a color value, returns a corresponding color name like 'Green'

element.name: ColorToString.Result
element.short: Returns the name of the color, expressed as a string (like 'Green').

element.name: ColorToString.Color
element.short: The Color to examine in the routine.

element.name: StringToColor

element.name: StringToColor.Result
element.short: Returns the color corresponding to the name in String S.

element.name: StringToColor.S
element.short: S - the name of the required color, expressed as a string.

element.name: InvertColor
element.short: InvertColor - returns the complementary color to the supplied value - helps to produce a 'negative' image.

element.name: InvertColor.Result
element.short: Returns the inverse of the original color (i.e. a 'negative' effect).

element.name: InvertColor.AColor

element.name: DecColor
