element.name: DecColor.Result
element.short: Returns a copy of the original color, decremented by a specified amount.

element.name: DecColor.AColor
element.short: AColor - the original color for processing.

element.name: DecColor.AQuantity
element.short: AQuantity - the amount by which the color is to be changed.

element.name: Blue
element.short: Finds the Blue component of the supplied color.

descr.p: Does not work with system color values.

element.name: Blue.Result
element.short: Returns the Blue component of the color specified in RGB.

element.name: Blue.rgb
element.short: The color for processing, expressed as a RGB value.

element.name: Green
element.short: Finds the Green component of the supplied color.

descr.p: Does not work with system color values.

element.name: Green.Result
element.short: Returns the Green component of the color specified in RGB.

element.name: Green.rgb
element.short: The color for processing, expressed as RGB.

element.name: Red
element.short: Finds the Red component of the supplied color.

descr.p: Does not work with system color values.

element.name: Red.Result
element.short: Returns the Red component of the color specified in RGB.

element.name: Red.rgb
element.short: The color for processing, expressed as RGB.

element.name: RGBToColor
element.short: Combines the values for Red, Green and Blue into a TColor value.

element.name: RGBToColor.Result
element.short: TColor value for the specified color components.

element.name: RGBToColor.R
element.short: Byte with the Red color component.

element.name: RGBToColor.G
element.short: Byte with the Green color component.

element.name: RGBToColor.B
element.short: Byte with the Blue color component.

element.name: RedGreenBlue
element.short: RedGreenBlue - decomposes a composite color into its component Red, Green and Blue values.

descr.p: Does not work with system color values.

element.name: RedGreenBlue.rgb
element.short: The color for processing, expressed as RGB.

element.name: RedGreenBlue.Red
element.short: The Red component of the color defined in RGB.

element.name: RedGreenBlue.Green
element.short: The Greencomponent of the color defined in RGB.

element.name: RedGreenBlue.Blue

element.short: Converts a TFPColor value to a Cardinal color reference used in API system color constants.

element.short: FPColorToTColor - converts a color specified as a FPColor to a color of type TColor.

element.name: FPColorToTColor.Result

element.short:
TColorToFPColor - converts a color of type TColor to one specified as a
FPColor.

descr.p: Does not work with system color values.

element.name: GetFontData
element.short: Gets font data for the specified font handle.

descr.p: Values from DefFontData are assigned as the default return value for the routine. No additional actions are performed in the routine when Font contains 0 (for an unassigned font handle). When the font handle is valid, the following members in the return value are updated:

element.name: GetFontData.Result
element.short: TFontData structure with values read in the routine.

element.name: GetFontData.Font
element.short: Font handle with the logical font data read in the routine.

element.name: IsFontNameXLogicalFontDesc
element.short: Determines if the specified font name is a valid X Logical Font Description.
element.descr: IsFontNameXLogicalFontDesc is a Boolean function used to determine whether the specified font name is a valid X Logical Font Description (XLFD).

element.name: IsFontNameXLogicalFontDesc.Result
element.short: True when the font name is a valid XLFD font name.

element.name: IsFontNameXLogicalFontDesc.LongFontName
element.short: Font name with segments examined in the routine.

element.name: XLFDNameToLogFont
element.short: Gets a logical font record with values representing the specified XLFD font descriptor.

descr.p: XLFDName contains the font descriptor examined in the function. Its value consists of delimited segments that contain the attributes for the font, including:

dl.dd: Ignored.
Ignored.
Font family.
Font weight.
Italic, Reverse Italic, Oblique.
Normal, Condensed, Narrow, Wide, Expanded.
Orientation or rotation.
Height in pixels.
Height in points.
Horizontal resolution in points.
Vertical resolution in points.
Monospace, Proportional, Character Cell (Fixed Pitch).
Average character width.
Ignored.
Ignored.

descr.p: Values read from the segments are converted, translated, and massaged into the values expected in the logical font record.

element.name: XLFDNameToLogFont.Result
element.short: TLogFont instance with values for the XLFD font.

element.name: XLFDNameToLogFont.XLFDName
element.short: Font descriptor examined in the routine.

element.name: ExtractXLFDItem
element.short: Gets the value for the specified segment in an XLFD font descriptor.

element.name: ExtractXLFDItem.Result
element.short: Value for the XLFD segment, or an empty string when not found.

element.name: ExtractXLFDItem.XLFDName
element.short: XLFD font descriptor examined in the routine.

element.name: ExtractXLFDItem.Index
element.short: Ordinal position (starting at 0) for the requested segment in XLFDName.

element.name: ExtractFamilyFromXLFDName
element.short: Gets the family name for the typeface used in the XLFD font descriptor.

descr.p: Parses a font name in XLFD format and extracts the FamilyName sequence with the typeface family name.

element.name: ExtractFamilyFromXLFDName.Result
element.short: Typeface family name found in XLFDName.

element.name: ExtractFamilyFromXLFDName.XLFDName
element.short: XLFD font descriptor examined in the routine.

element.name: ClearXLFDItem
element.short: Replaces the specified XLFD segment value with the '*' wildcard.

element.name: ClearXLFDHeight
element.short: Replaces the PixelSize, PointSize, ResolutionX, ResolutionY and AverageWidth segments in an XLFD font name with the '*' wildcard.

element.name: ClearXLFDPitch
element.short: Replaces the spacing for a XLFD font descriptor format with a '*' wildcard.

element.name: ClearXLFDStyle
element.short: Replaces the WeightName, Slant and SetwidthName segments in an XLFD font name with the '*' wildcard.

element.name: XLFDHeightIsSet
element.short: Checks whether an explicit value is assigned to XLFD segments controlling font height.

descr.p: Skip comments and searches for the 'static [const] [unsigned] char*' statement in the stream.

element.name: TestStreamIsXPM.AStream

element.name: TestStreamIsIcon.Result

element.name: TestStreamIsIcon.AStream

element.name: TestStreamIsCursor

element.name: TestStreamIsCursor.Result
element.short: True when the .CUR signature is found in the stream.

element.name: TestStreamIsCursor.AStream
element.short: TStream instance examined in the routine.

descr.p: Converts an XPM image file into an array of PChar values. The memory is allocated as one block, so freeing can simply be done using FreeMem. The data is just behind the array.

An XPM file can be included in a C source file, because it has a C syntax. In the compiled program it is simply an array of PChar. This function converts an XPM source file to the same array, by removing the comments and the string constant symbols.

element.name: LazResourceXPMToPPChar
element.descr: Loads an XPM image from the specified resource name into an array of PChar values. See XPMToPPChar for more info.

element.name: ReadXPMFromStream
element.descr: Converts an XPM image stored in the specified stream into an array of PChar values. See XPMToPPChar for more info.

element.name: ReadXPMSize
element.descr: Reads the first line from an XPM PChar array which contains the width, height and number of colors for the XPM data.

element.short: LoadCursorFromLazarusResource - loads a named cursor handle from the Lazarus Resource (.LRS).

element.short: Creates and loads a TGraphic instance using the specified instance handle and resource name.

element.name: CreateBitmapFromLazarusResource
element.short: Creates and loads a Bitmap from a Lazarus Resource (.lrs) file.

element.name: CreateBitmapFromFPImage
element.short: Creates a Bitmap with the content from the specified TFPCustomImage instance.

descr.p: Creates a temporary TLazIntfImage instance used to copy the image content in Img into the TBitmap instance in the return value.

element.name: CreateBitmapFromFPImage.Result
element.short: TBitmap instance created and loaded in the routine.

element.name: CreateBitmapFromFPImage.Img
element.short: TFPCustomImage with the content copied into the return value.

element.name: AllocPatternBitmap
element.short: Ensures that a Pattern Bitmap with the specified colors exists in the Pattern cache.

descr.p: AllocPatternBitmap is a TBitmap function used to ensure that a bitmap with the specified colors exists in the internal pattern cache.

AllocPatternBitmap tries to locate a TPatternBitmap instance with the colors specified in colorBG and colorFG. If the requested Pattern Bitmap does not already exist, it is created and added to the pattern cache.

The return value is the TBitmap instance stored in the Bitmap property for the cached TPatternBitmap instance. No actions are performed if the Pattern cache has not been assigned; the return value is Nil in this situation.

element.name: AllocPatternBitmap.Result
element.short: Bitmap retrieved or created with the specified colors.

element.name: AllocPatternBitmap.colorBG
element.short: Background color for the Bitmap.

element.name: AllocPatternBitmap.colorFG
element.short: Foreground color for the Bitmap.

element.name: ScreenInfo
element.short: Contains display attributes for the current screen in an application.

descr.p: ScreenInfo is a TScreenInfo variable which contains display attributes for the current screen in an application, including:

dl.dd: Horizontal display density (Pixels Per Inch). Default is 72.
Vertical display density (Pixels Per Inch). Default is 72.
Number of colors used in image data. Default is 24.
Default value is False.

descr.p: Values in ScreenInfo are updated when an application initializes the widgetset classes used in the LCL interface.
ScreenInfo is used in the implementation of the ScaleX and ScaleY routines.

element.name: FontResourceCache
element.short: Variable used as the cache for Font resources.

descr.p: FontResourceCache is a TFontHandleCache variable used as the cache for Font resources. FontResourceCache allows reference-counted font handles to be created or retrieved when the ReferenceNeeded method in TFont is called. Values in FontResourceCache are maintained when the FreeReference method in TFont is called.
Resources for FontResourceCache are allocated when the Graphuic.pp unit is initialized, and freed when the unit is finalized.

element.name: PenResourceCache
element.short: Variable used as the cache for Pen resources.

element.name: BrushResourceCache
element.short: Variable used as the cache for Brush resources.

element.name: FontCharsets
element.short: Array constant with TIdentMapEntry values for character sets in TFont instances.

descr.p: Array elements contain TIdentMapEntry record instances which map the numeric identifier for a character set to its representation as a string value.

element.name: DbgS
element.short: Creates a formatted debugger message with values from the TFontStyles set.

descr.p: Return value contains the formatted set of font styles, with content like:

element.name: DbgS.Result
element.short: Message formatted for use in the debugger.

element.name: DbgS.Style
element.short: Set of TFontStyle values included in the formatted string.

element.name: ScaleX
element.short: Resizes the specified horizontal size from a given display density to the current screen PPI.

descr.p: Multiplies the values in SizeX and the PixelsPerInchX member in ScreenInfo, and divides the product by the value in FromDPI. The return value is rounded to the nearest Integer value.

element.name: ScaleX.Result
element.short: New horizontal size after scaling.

element.name: ScaleX.SizeX
element.short: Size value scaled in the routine.

element.name: ScaleX.FromDPI
element.short: Original display density (Pixels per Inch).

element.name: ScaleY
element.short: Resizes the specified vertical size from a given display density to the current screen PPI.

descr.p: Multiplies the values in SizeY and the PixelsPerInchY member in ScreenInfo, and divides the product by the value in FromDPI. The return value is rounded to the nearest Integer value.

element.name: ScaleY.Result
element.short: New vertical size after scaling.

element.name: ScaleY.SizeY
element.short: Size value scaled in the routine.

element.name: ScaleY.FromDPI
element.short: Original display density (Pixels per Inch).

element.name: Register
element.short: Registers TPersistent classes for use in the RTL.

descr.p: Register calls RegisterClasses to add the following persistent objects to the list of classes available in the RTL:

element.name: UpdateHandleObjects
element.short: Renews handles for Fonts, Pens, and Brushes.

topic.name: Progress
topic.short: Monitoring the progress of drawing a complicated Graphic.

descr.p: TProgressEvent is a generic progress notification event which may be used by TGraphic classes with computationally intensive (slow) operations, such as loading, storing, or transforming image data.

td.p: Indicates whether this call to the OnProgress event is to prepare for, process, or clean up after a graphic operation.

If OnProgress is called at all, the first call for a graphic operation will be with Stage = psStarting, to allow the OnProgress event handler to allocate whatever resources it needs to process subsequent progress notifications. After Stage = psStarting, you are guaranteed that OnProgress will be called again with Stage = psEnding to allow you to free those resources, even if the graphic operation is aborted by an exception.
Zero or more calls to OnProgress with Stage = psRunning may occur between the psStarting and psEnding calls.

tr.td: The ratio of work done to work remaining, on a scale of 0 to 100. Values may repeat or even regress (get smaller) in successive calls. PercentDone is usually only a guess, and the guess may be dramatically altered as new information is discovered in decoding the image. The value of this property could usefully be passed to a ProgressBar to show the user how drawing is progressing

Indicates whether the graphic can be/should be redrawn immediately. Useful for showing successive approximations of an image as data is available instead of waiting for all the data to arrive before drawing anything. Since there is no message loop activity during graphic operations, you should call Update to force a control to be redrawn immediately in the OnProgress event handler. Redrawing a graphic when RedrawNow = False could corrupt the image and/or cause exceptions.
Area of image that has changed and needs to be redrawn.

Optional text describing in one or two words what the graphic class is currently working on. Ex: "Loading", "Storing", "Reducing colors", etc. The Msg string can also be empty. Msg strings should be resourced for translation, should not contain trailing periods, and should be used only for display purposes. (Do not use the construct: if Msg = 'Loading' then...)
